response: Goodland Kitchen, located at 231 S Magnolia Ave in Goleta, CA, is a versatile establishment offering a range of services including food, local services, and shopping. Categorized as a restaurant serving American (New) cuisine, it operates from 7:00 AM to 2:00 PM on weekdays. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating with no WiFi available, and the restaurant supports takeout orders but does not offer reservations. One customer praised the friendly service and the variety of lunch options, including chorizo and huge salads. Another review highlighted the reopening of the business and encouraged support for this small establishment, noting its amazing service and wonderful food. However, a previous review criticized the food for being unremarkable and lacking innovation, indicating a decline in the quality of dishes served. Despite mixed reviews, Goodland Kitchen maintains a business rating of 3.5 stars.

review_info.review_text: Always delicious, quality ingredients and in goos portions too, never not left satisfied from any Habit I've been to

Best burgers in town! Got a turkey burger with avocado and a little bit of bacon. Sooooo good! The bun was toasted to perfection. The people working there are always super kind and proactive. It always sounds like they are having a good time in all the rush.

This is an easy all around good hamburger place. There are options for kids and any adult with some healthy choices to go with it. I stick to the charburger with cheese or the steak sandwich, can't really be disappointed. There is also a kids meal that includes a great apple juice and fries for those kids who just have to have them! No matter what get the tempura green beans and onion rings; heck, you could skip the burgers and just have those!!! Easy parking and a buzzer if you want to wait in car with the kids.

response:
Habit Burger Grill, situated at 3890 La Cumbre Plz Ln in Santa Barbara, CA, is a highly-rated restaurant that specializes in burgers and is known for its quality ingredients and generous portions. The restaurant is open from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on weekdays, and it offers a variety of dining options, including outdoor seating and takeout services. Customers can park in the lot nearby, and the restaurant also provides a buzzer system for customers who prefer to wait in their cars.

Habit Burger Grill has received a 4.0 star rating based on customer reviews, with many highlighting the delicious and satisfying meals. The turkey burger with avocado and bacon, as well as the charburger with cheese, are particularly praised for their flavor and preparation. Additionally, the restaurant is commended for its friendly and proactive staff and its convenient parking options. The ambiance is described as casual, making it a great spot for groups and families.

review_info.review_text: I've finally found my sushi spot in town! & it's close to the newer Handlebar coffee. My husband only eats rice dishes and I love a little bit of both sushi and Japanese homey dishes. In most places in town, they are only good at one or the other. This place is great at both. The family feel of this restaurant is great. They were all so friendly and we felt really welcomed.  We can't wait to go back!  I've also had their food delivered and it travels really well.

Best santa barbara Uni sushi in United State.
An authentic hole in a wall Japanese restaurant owned by a very nice Japanese owner.
Other pupus and entrees are very good as well.
Temporary they are serving food with plastic containers which is understandable too.

My girlfriend and i were both craving japanese food, and this was the perfect spot. A very laid back place with a diverse menu, fresh fish, and great entrees. Not to mention lovely staff! We ordered quite a few things, and our favorites were the tuna crispy rice, yakiniku, and katsu curry rice! I would certainly suggest coming here!

response: Edomasa, located at 2710 De La Vina St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a local sushi bar and Japanese restaurant that has garnered a reputation for its diverse menu and welcoming ambiance. The restaurant is open from 5:00 PM to 9:30 PM from Tuesday through Saturday, offering patrons a consistent dining experience throughout the week. Customers can find street and lot parking nearby, and the restaurant supports takeout orders but does not offer reservations or outdoor seating. According to reviews, Edomasa excels in both sushi and traditional Japanese home-style dishes, making it a standout option in the local dining scene. The restaurant's authentic atmosphere, friendly service, and high-quality food, particularly the Uni sushi and fresh fish, have received praise. Patrons appreciate the family-like feel of the restaurant and its ability to accommodate various tastes and preferences. The convenience of takeout and the food's ability to travel well also adds to its appeal. With an overall rating of 3.5 stars and multiple 5-star reviews, Edomasa is a favored spot for both casual and group dining.

review_info.review_text: So I ordered a sandwich from here on Black Friday. There was nothing on the website that stated they are closed and not accepting ordered. So when I walked to south coast they were closed. I checked my email confirmation and it said my sandwich wasn't going to be ready till the Monday. If that's not shady, inconvenient and rude Idk what is. So I made an order again, on Friday but this time I called. I asked to speak with the manager and I told him what had happened. He said they are working on processing the orders but that I should have received the refund already, I told him it wasn't there and then he said  my refund should be in by Wednesday the latest. So I went ahead and ordered and paid for another sandwich. I even tipped them. So Wednesday comes around and nothing. So Friday comes and I call and the manager isn't there, supposedly he was going to be in the next day. I left my name and number and no call back. Monday or Tuesday rolls along and I call back and speak with the manager Blair. He politely says they are working on processing the orders still that there was an issue with the systems. So I wait a few days and he calls me back, doesn't leave a voicemail, we're  playing phone tag at this point and I finally got to speak with him yesterday. He says the owner already processed the orders and that my refund should be there. Well it wasn't. Just like he claimed a few days before. Now why would I go through the trouble of lying and doing all of this? I even asked if they could just give me a free sandwich and drink and call it even. That's the right thing to do. I even told him I'll show you my bank statements, and he agreed to it. I told him, I'll be there after 3pm, I really like coming to this place for my lunch breaks. So I ordered another sandwich over the phone. I get there and the associate screen shots my statements and then tells me he can't give it to me for free. That they need to handle it with the higher up's. I asked he could call his manager and he refused. So I walked out. I'm not supporting a business that steals people's hard earned money. They took $17.26 from me. They deserve or need free donation. They are million dollar company that lacks integrity. The owner should be ashamed of himself and the manager Blair, next  time you call, leave a voice mail like a true professional. That's what managers are suppose to do.

Santa Barbara Life hack, stopping by South Coast Deli makes the day that much better!! Love supporting local businesses! When the foods this good it makes it really easy! Best bang for your buck lunch spot in town! Thank you South Coast Deli, keep up the great work!
The sandwich was a bit overwhelming sometimes simplicity goes a long way. Too big to bite. Wheat roll was not soft. If you like BIG, MEATY, SAUCES sandwich this is your place.

response: South Coast Deli, located at 10 E Carrillo St in Santa Barbara, California, is a local eatery known for its sandwiches and salads. Operating from Monday to Saturday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM, the deli offers a casual dining experience with outdoor seating and free WiFi. Patrons can enjoy their meals on-site or opt for takeout, but reservations are not available. The deli's ambiance is described as casual, and it caters to groups of varying sizes. However, customer experiences have been mixed. While one reviewer praised the deli for its high-quality, affordable lunch options and expressed appreciation for its local business status, another customer had a negative experience with an online order issue and subsequent poor customer service. Despite the mixed reviews, South Coast Deli maintains a solid 4.0-star rating, indicating generally positive feedback from its patrons.

review_info.review_text: Serious hidden gem. I ate wayyyy too much there!!!!  Best tomato soup I've ever had. Loved the club sandwich and devoured the Mediterranean plate. Seriously, this should be a more obvious spot to stop for lunch!
Love this place! Great food, great service! It was raining today so I had the tomato soup wasn't expecting it to be the best tomato soup I've had! Definitely a great lunch spot.
Yum!! What a delicious sandwich I just enjoyed!! The cubana was full of chicken and ham and bacon and avocados and red onions. What more can I say then yummy!!

response: Museum Cafe, located at 1130 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a versatile establishment offering a blend of cafe, restaurant, and deli services. Known for its exceptional food quality, the cafe has earned a 4.5-star rating based on customer reviews. Open primarily during lunch hours from Tuesday to Sunday, it provides a convenient spot for those seeking a meal. Parking options include garage and street parking. Notable amenities include take-out services and the ability to make reservations, though outdoor seating is not available. Customers have particularly praised the cafe's tomato soup, club sandwiches, and Mediterranean plates. The atmosphere is described as casual, making it a great option for group outings. Positive reviews highlight the delicious food and excellent service, with one customer describing it as a "serious hidden gem."

source_info.name: Renaud's Patisserie & Bistro
source_info.address: 1324 State St, Ste N, Arlington Plaza
source_info.categories: Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, French, Salad, Sandwiches, Desserts, Bakeries, Food

review_info.review_text:
Ambience is good, cute outdoor seating. 
Coffee was very good.
Butter croissant was the best, which is the opposite of other places.
Pain Aux Raisins - pretty good, not enough raisins
Cinnamon hazelnut roll - not too much cinnamon, kind of dry. Wasn't a bug fan.
Chocolate croissant - pretty good.
They made couple of mistakes with our order but we're very nice to fix it when we mentioned.

My experience started off terrible and ended terrible. To begin I waited in line while the cashier was on the phone with a customer only to pick up the phone yet again and take another order for 5 minutes before taking mine. While another staff member just stood there doing nothing then proceeds to take someone else's order that had just walked in. I spent over $100 there and to be honest the croissants especially chocolate were no better than Albertsons and the ones I was served on airfrance put renauds to shame. An airline... this place has gone down hill since they expanded. The hazelnut roll I asked for was grabbed from the back not from the front case which I found weird they tasted stale or at least a day old. The lemon tart was overly sweet it made our tongues pucker with the need to down a glass of water. The $15 stollen was stale and lacking dried fruit and nuts. Not traditional stollen.  This is the type of place that I will forever think of as a stop on the way out of town for a road trip as in fast food. There are better more traditional bakeries in town that actually care about quality and consumer experience and are not just as dark un-updated hole in the wall. Would be nice if the tarts didn't all come in the same mold. Where is the creativity for the price you charge. Service and quality are below sub par. Get it together or stop expanding.

Terribly long wait for 2 latte's. Had to ask twice for our order and had 4 different sit-down customers get served before us with food while they didn't bother letting us wait. Seen the server check our number as well so they simply wanted to ignore us. When they finally gave us the lattes, they were served in to-go cups and gave us 2 smalls when one was a medium and gave an excuse that he put extra espresso anyways. Wish I would've had the chance to experience this place before leaving a tip. Would highly recommend going elsewhere if you choose to be appreciated

response: Renaud's Patisserie & Bistro, situated at 1324 State St, Ste N, Arlington Plaza in Santa Barbara, California, is a versatile establishment known for its French cuisine, including coffee and tea, breakfast and brunch, salads, sandwiches, and desserts. Open from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM daily except on Mondays, the bistro offers ample parking in the lot and supports takeout orders. Customers appreciate the cozy, classy, and casual ambience, complemented by outdoor seating when available. A positive review highlighted the exceptional butter croissant and the friendly staff who promptly corrected order mistakes, while another praised the coffee quality. However, negative reviews criticized the long wait times, poor customer service, and the inconsistency in the quality of pastries, suggesting that some items were stale or not up to par with expectations. The business has received a 4.0-star rating overall, reflecting a mix of satisfied and dissatisfied customers.

review_info.review_text: The sushi was mediocre but I still like the environment and the service!

"after a lovely day at the beach, my husband and i decided to finish off the day with some sushi. we'd eaten at piranha before and enjoyed it, but after tonight's experience, i can safely say we will never return. it wasn't heinous--but for 80$, the quality of the food and service was pretty abysmal. not only was the sushi NOT super fresh and tasty, especially as compared to katsuya in encino, but the waitstaff was inattentive (we had to call out for the hostess finally to get our waitress's attention), the waitress made a mistake on our order and did not recitfy it (she brought out sea urchin instead of eel--when we brought it to her attention, she did not remove the unwanted, uneaten item from our bill), AND there was a long hair in one of our rolls! At most sushi establishments, they bring out the items as they are prepared, but here, we had to wait a fairly long time before  being served, and then it was everything, all at once.  Plus, i really like it when the meal commences with a nice, warm hand towel and some complimentary edaname--typical of most sushi places, but NOT here. Overall, a very unpleasant, unappetizing, unsatisfying gastronomical experience!"

This is a nice place to sit outside on State St.  I was a tad bit early for sushi (they don't start making sushi until 5:30), so I decided on their Warm Spinach Salad instead.  It was deeeelish.  I had a blackberry martini to sip on, which was also really good.  The server was really nice and attentive the entire time.  

I've also been here previously and have sat in their outside area upstairs, which is also nice.  

I'm curious to try their sushi soon, which might alter my rating.

response:
Piranha Restaurant & Sushi Bar, located at 714 State St in Santa Barbara, California, is a dining establishment that primarily serves sushi and other restaurant fare. It offers a pleasant outdoor seating option, which has been noted positively by customers. The restaurant supports reservations and takeout orders, catering to diverse customer needs. While it does not provide its own parking facilities, it accommodates groups well.

Customer reviews highlight a mixed experience. One patron enjoyed the ambiance and service despite finding the sushi to be of mediocre quality. Another review detailed a disappointing experience with subpar food quality and poor service, including a mistake in the order and the discovery of a hair in one of the sushi rolls, which significantly detracted from the overall dining experience. Another customer praised the restaurant for its tasty Warm Spinach Salad and attentive service, expressing interest in trying the sushi in the future. These varying accounts reflect the restaurant’s inconsistent service and food quality, leading to an average rating of 3.0 stars.

review_info.review_text: Pretty sure I got food poisoning from expired cabbage in the chow mein 2 days ago. Should have trusted my nose.

I've been to this location many times and the selections are always empty and they need to cook them to fulfill an order. 

Tonight we went and ordered Beef and Broccoli and Teriyaki Chicken. Of course we had to wait 10 min for the chicken and once we arrived home we find there is no Teriyaki Sauce and No Beef in the Broccoli. 

Poor experience.

Extremely rude customer service will not be returning not only did
The cashier give me attitude but he seemed bothered to be asked for a fork ridiculous

response:
Panda Express, located at 605 Paseo Nuevo in Santa Barbara, California, is a fast-food restaurant specializing in Chinese cuisine. The establishment is open daily from 10:30 AM to 8:00 PM and offers takeout services. It has outdoor seating, making it a convenient spot for those looking to enjoy their meal al fresco. However, the restaurant does not offer reservations, garage, street, validated, lot, or valet parking.

Customer feedback has been largely negative, with several complaints regarding the quality and freshness of the food. One customer reported experiencing food poisoning from potentially expired cabbage in the chow mein. Another customer faced issues with missing ingredients and a lack of sauce in their order. Additionally, there have been criticisms of poor customer service, including rudeness and a lack of basic amenities such as providing a fork.

Despite its shortcomings, the restaurant is noted for its upscale and casual ambience, but these positive attributes have not been enough to offset the negative experiences reported by customers, resulting in a low rating of 2.5 stars.

review_info.review_text:
Can we save Beachside Bar and Cafe? Can we get enough people to commit to spend $100.00 a month in purchases to keep it open? I will! We all have to eat, and why not get great food? I neglected to support them with take out until recently, my mistake. If we can get a 1,000 people in Santa Barbara to commit to spending something every month, will that be enough?

Dave are you listening? We need to keep Beachside open. The wounds of losing Jaspers are still sore, we cannot lose Beachside too!

Social media geeks please get on this. Let's spread the word.
 
Come on Santa Barbara, we are better than this! Let's all save Beachside!

A 35 year fan

Can't say enough about the meal we had delivered right to our truck!! After a gorgeous day of jet skiing, we decided we were too tired to cook! Pulled up to the beachside and ordered King crab veggies and salad being that were on a keto program it fit the bill!! They brought it right out to our truck hot and fresh!! Salads were premixed awesome!!! Crab was fresh and sweet! Veggies were perfectly cooked!! Thank you Beachside and Carlos for ending our day on a super high note!!!!

Stopped here on recommendation of a friend, and to get their Key Lime Pie.  It was a little awkward doing the take-out order for a few reasons.  You had to walk up a ramp to place your order, and the ramp is long enough for 2 people/parties to stand on it at the same time, but it's not wide enough to walk past the person behind you after you've ordered without getting really close to them.  NOT easy to maintain good social distancing.  

The staff was friendly but overall it felt like the place was really understaffed.  It took a long time for someone to just come and take our order.  They had a dessert menu but it wasn't posted anywhere (though the regular menu was visible in 4+ locations).  So it took time for someone to come help us, it didn't take long for them to find the dessert menu but it would have been faster for me to order if I'd been able to see it before I got to the order point.  Anyway finally did get my order placed, finally paid for and signed for and it did arrive.  

Overall process took too long to get a slice of pie, but the pie was very good.  SUPER tart so be aware of that.  Default comes with chopped almonds on top and some strawberry(?) sauce drizzled under it.  Also some whipped cream.  Hubby liked how tart it was (and he's very picky about this) but he doesn't like almonds or the strawberry sauce so he was bummed by the unexpected fanciness.  It's okay because now we know how we'll order it next time.  :)  I do expect to return.  

I'll be happier when it's safe to dine in as this place has a big patio with a gorgeous view of the ocean.

response:
Beachside Bar-Cafe, located at 5905 Sandspit Rd in Goleta, CA, is a versatile establishment that offers American (New) cuisine, seafood, and a range of bar options. It maintains consistent operating hours from Monday through Sunday, opening at 11:30 AM and closing at 9:00 PM. The restaurant is equipped with a parking lot but lacks garage, street, validated, and valet parking options. Customers can reserve tables, enjoy outdoor seating, and appreciate a casual yet classy ambience. Although WiFi is not available, the restaurant supports group dining and offers takeout services.

Reviews highlight the restaurant's strengths, with patrons praising the quality of food, especially seafood and desserts like the key lime pie. A memorable experience involved a delivery of fresh king crab, vegetables, and salads to customers enjoying a jet ski day. However, some reviews noted issues with understaffing and long wait times for takeout orders. Despite these challenges, the restaurant's loyal customers advocate for its survival, considering it an integral part of the local dining scene.

review_info.review_text:
Ambience: What ambiance?

Service: We are still laughing. The waitress never even cracked a smile. We were very thankful for our ONE water refill.

Food: It's never a good sign when you hear the microwave dinger go off more than the order bell. Seriously? $40.00 for that??

Time with friends: Priceless.
Sad to have to report that they have closed this location. Thank you to the Ortiz family for many good meals over the years!

My husband and I are addicted to the Shrimp Ala Diablo. The salsa bar is fantastic,  and the service from Beto's family and the crew is wonderful. Tacos Altamirano are unbelievably tasty as well. Skip the place up the street. This has no line and the food is fresh and wonderful. Love, love, love this place!

response:
Altamirano Mexican Restaurant, located at 422 N Milpas St, Ste 1 in Santa Barbara, California, is a Mexican restaurant that offers a variety of traditional dishes. The restaurant is open from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM, with slightly extended hours on weekdays. Customers can park on the street or in a nearby lot, and the restaurant provides takeout service but does not offer reservations or outdoor seating. WiFi is not available.

The restaurant's ambiance and customer service have been mixed in reviews, with one customer noting a lack of atmosphere and unfriendly service, while another highly praises the service and the family-oriented experience. The restaurant also does not feature a romantic or upscale ambience. The food quality varies, with one customer criticizing the use of microwaves and the high price, while another raves about the Shrimp Ala Diablo and the freshness of the food. The restaurant has received a 4.0-star rating overall, reflecting its mixed reception.

While the restaurant offers a casual dining experience and is good for groups, the quality and consistency of food and service have been points of contention among customers.

review_info.review_text: This was our first time at Sams and it was delicious!! Excellent customer service, they were so sweet. We got the #11 Italian cold cuts, and the veggie sandwich #29 both were so good! The bread was so fresh and you could tell the ingredients were really quality! My daughter got the turkey sandwich and she is the pickiest eater and she loved it! Can't wait to go back

The couple who runs the place are so nice and funny, and the sandwiches are delicious. It doesn't look fancy, but do yourself a favor and try it out. The Pastrami Avocado and Cheese was delicious. Warning, the medium size sandwich is BIG.

I've been going to Sam's for the past several years while visiting beautiful Santa Barbara from the San Francisco Bay area. I've always enjoyed the sandwiches from Sam's. Unfortunately, my wife and I just finished eating their turkey sandwich and in all honesty, it' was just, Ok, more like disappointing...

We were disappointed because it appears the quality and taste of the sandwich has digressed to a "point of no return"... The sandwich was sloppily made, poorly wrapped, and importantly, the man behind the counter (usual guy) seems to have gotten cantankerous over time. He chastised me for not ordering both white and wheat bread sandwiches the way he wanted, getting perturbed for asking for olives in my sandwich and, he had a smart alec - bad attitude demeanor about him - poor customer service.

Suffice it to say, we will not be going back to Sam's. There are too many good delis in the Cliffs Dr. area to be subjected to poor quality sandwiches and an unpleasant customer experience...

response: Sam's To Go, located at 315 Meigs Rd, Ste I in Santa Barbara, California, is a local establishment known for its sandwiches and American cuisine. Operating from 10:00 AM to either 9:30 PM or 10:00 PM, depending on the day, Sam's To Go offers a casual dining experience with outdoor seating available. Customers can enjoy free WiFi and take-out options, making it convenient for busy individuals or groups looking for a quick meal. The business is praised for its excellent customer service and quality ingredients, as evidenced by positive reviews highlighting friendly staff and delicious sandwiches, such as the Italian cold cuts and turkey options. However, one reviewer noted a decline in sandwich quality and customer service, suggesting variability in the dining experience. Despite this, Sam's To Go remains a popular choice among locals and visitors alike, boasting a 4.5-star rating.

source_info.name: Viva Modern Mexican
source_info.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Venues & Event Spaces, Peruvian, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Nightlife, Latin American, Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Seafood, Tapas/Small Plates, Mexican

review_info.review_text: so sad !!!! It was so good. If you open somewhere else will you let your fans know ! Loved your margarita flights ( the best fresh margaritas I have ever had ) and light fresh,flavorful  salads.

My husband got really bad food poisoning from this place. We ate there Friday evening and he's been vomiting etc since. He is currently in the ER for treatment. To top it off they dropped a plate and glass flew everywhere and cut my ankle.

We had our rehearsal dinner and welcome party here in July and it was so perfect!! We rented the upstairs space for the evening and had 30 guests for the rehearsal dinner and then the rest of the guests (about 75 people) joined after for drinks. The taco buffet was delicious!!! And the space was exactly what we wanted for our group.  Dina, the Events Coordinator, was incredibly helpful throughout our planning process, starting in January and right through the event itself. All of the staff here were amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking to host a similar event, or even for dinner - the food was amazing!!

response: Viva Modern Mexican is a versatile establishment located at 1114 State St in Santa Barbara, California, offering a blend of Mexican, Peruvian, and Latin American cuisine. Known for its extensive menu that includes tapas, seafood, and cocktails, the restaurant has garnered a mix of reviews, resulting in a 3.5-star rating. Customers praise its fresh margarita flights and flavorful salads, as well as its ability to host successful events. Positive reviews highlight the excellent service provided by staff, particularly the Events Coordinator, Dina, during the planning and execution of events. However, there are also critical reviews, including an instance of severe food poisoning reported by one customer. Despite this, the restaurant provides a range of amenities such as free WiFi, outdoor seating, and the option for reservations, catering to a diverse clientele.

source_info.name: Bree'osh
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Food, French, Coffee & Tea, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch

review_info.review_text:
Perfection!! My boyfriend and I came to Bree'osh for a day trip to Santa Barbara from LA and this was our first stop. It was everything we wanted and more! We got a croissant, the Bree'Osh Breakfast Sandwich, and a Three Egg Omelette with mushrooms, gruyere, and spinach. The croissant was delicate, crispy on the outside, and airy on the inside with just enough softness and chew - simple done right! The omelette was also done very well; they were extremely generous with the mushrooms and it was well flavored. The egg was soft and buttery. The bree'osh breakfast sandwich was my favorite!! As someone who loves burgers, this was exactly what I wanted for brunch. It was so tasty and very filling, and the brioche bread was amazing! I wish the egg was a little bit saltier, but it was not hard to add salt myself. 

Overall, 5 stars for sure! We can't wait to come back!

Great staff. Kiersten and Kathy do it again with a smile behind that mask

As you can see from the mushroom croissant that my friend had they are very generous with the mushrooms. Even though sometimes there a fair amount of people when you when we regularly find an outdoor seat

I bring my own sea salt.  It's particularly good on the mushroom cheese croissant

Absolutely heavenly baked goods! Like, unreal how good they are. I also got a grilled cheese, which was divine and came with a nice side salad, making it a complete meal for a decent price, which I totally appreciated. I also got a chai latte which was windy and not overly sweet.

response: Bree'osh is a highly rated French bakery and restaurant located at 1150 Coast Village Rd, Ste E in Santa Barbara, California. Known for its exceptional breakfast and brunch options, Bree'osh offers a delightful selection of French pastries, sandwiches, and coffee. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating and free WiFi while savoring their meals. The business is open Tuesday through Sunday from 7:00 AM to 2:00 PM, with shorter hours on Fridays. Bree'osh does not offer reservations, but it caters to takeout orders and allows for parking on the street. Reviews highlight the quality of their baked goods, particularly the croissants and mushroom cheese croissants, which are generously filled. The Bree'Osh Breakfast Sandwich and Three Egg Omelette also receive praise for their flavor and generous portions. Customers appreciate the friendly staff and the reasonable prices, making Bree'osh a top choice for those seeking a delightful French-inspired dining experience.

source_info.name: Tupelo Junction Cafe
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional), American (New), Southern

review_info.review_text: The food was great!  We brought our kids and they were pretty accommodating given that they didn't have a kids' menu.  The scrambles were pretty good, the cinnamon apple beignets were excellent.  The crab bloody Mary was a little watery but still spicy.  I could have rated this 5 stars but we've never spent $80 on a brunch so it's just 4 stars.
This place has incredible breakfast. They just moved to Newport Beach California. There are no longer in Santa Barbara :(

NOTICE!  It looks like Tupelo Junction has been shuttered for good. With no warning or messaging beyond some vague rumors that they forgot to renew their liquor license, it appears that it's gone.  Their website and listing here on Yelp still show it as active but the sign is down, the windows are covered in brown paper, and they don't answer the phone. R.I.P. Tupelo Junction.  Gonna miss that French toast!

response:
Tupelo Junction Cafe is a restaurant located at 1218 State St in Santa Barbara, California, offering a variety of cuisine including traditional and new American, as well as Southern dishes. The cafe primarily serves breakfast and brunch, catering to a wide range of customers, including families. It's open from 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM on Mondays for breakfast and from 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM every day for dinner. The cafe provides amenities like garage parking and reservations, and it accommodates outdoor seating. However, it does not offer WiFi or validated parking. The cafe is noted for its group-friendly atmosphere and casual ambience.

Customer reviews highlight the quality of food, with the scrambles and cinnamon apple beignets receiving particular praise. However, one customer found the price of brunch to be quite high, while another noted that the cafe had moved to Newport Beach. Unfortunately, a recent review indicates that the establishment may no longer be in operation, as the location appears to be closed without notice. Despite the closure, the cafe had earned a solid 4-star rating based on customer satisfaction with its food and service.

review_info.review_text:
The dumplings here were good!! I got the combo #3 which had 8 dumplings, 4 chicken wings, and a soda. I got the 3 flavor dumplings (chives, pork, shrimp) and I thought they were so tasty. If you dip the dumplings in the chili oil sauce mixed with soy sauce, it really brings out the flavor. However, I thought the chicken wings would have been juicier and had more flavor, but they tasted really plain. I was disappointed for sure. 
My friend got the combo #2 which had 8 dumplings, spiced beef, and a soda. The spiced beef looked and tasted dry but she said the celery and beef dumplings were good too.
I'm actually surprised how full I got off that one combo though.

If you want quick, easy, and yummy dumplings near UCSB's campus or just in SB or Isla Vista, Dumpling King is the place for you! The service could be better but that's how you know it's authentic. Also, it's family-owned!

There's lots of booth seating in the back and you can look into the glass cases to see all of their offerings. Their prices are great and I'd recommend you get dumplings to-go for later to keep in your freezer!

I got quite a few pork and shrimp dumplings to-go on a travel day. Great prices and value, and the dumplings were just very tasty too!

They also have chicken wings, skewers, and some soups and noodles.

Food: best dish = three flavors dumpling (shrimp, pork, chives). Beef dumplings were just okay. Fried chicken was kinda gross with lots of hair still on the chicken

Service / atmosphere: non-existent... when it's not rush hour you feel like you're in the owners' living room, because they chat on the phone loudly and yell at you from the counter when your food is ready

If I came back, it would only be to get takeout of the three flavors dumplings

response: Dumpling King, located at 966 Embarcadero Del Mar, Ste C in Isla Vista, CA, is a Chinese restaurant known for its variety of dumplings and other Asian dishes. The restaurant offers takeout and outdoor seating, with parking available on the street and in nearby lots. It is open from 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM on most days, extending to 11:00 PM on Fridays. Customers have praised the restaurant for its tasty dumplings, particularly the three-flavor dumplings (chives, pork, shrimp), which are a standout item. However, other menu items, such as chicken wings and spiced beef, have received mixed reviews. The atmosphere is described as casual and authentic, with a family-owned feel, though service can be inconsistent. The restaurant’s affordability and convenient location near UCSB's campus make it a popular choice among students and locals seeking a quick, delicious meal.

review_info.review_text: I miss the old menu a lot! The staff here isn't as friendly and the bartenders drink on the job here including there bar manager! Where's Tom at to take control! Saw the manager tana take shots with employees and completely ignoring guest! Not okay!

So, so, so excited to have new chef and brand new menu. The favorites from the old still remain but they have been kicked up a notch in flavor. It was such a pleasant surprise and long overdue.

I get the Korean chicken wings. I can honestly say they are the best at Hollister and now the chicken comes juicy, not dry, and tons of flavor.

I love that Hollister makes their own dressings. I do like getting a salad every once in awhile.

My hubs was actually pleased with the change and finally enjoys eating there. We will be there today!

Hollister is conveniently located in a large shopping area and has an array of beers they brew right in the restaurant. Full bar and some wine to choose from.

Hollister has been a staple with my family and we are so happy there's a new menu. Give it a try!!

Waited 30min until asked to take our drink & food order. 
Very slow service, if your hungry don't expect to eat soon you will be waiting along time. We had kids and already sat down or else we would of left .

response: Hollister Brewing Company is a restaurant and brewery located at 6980 Marketplace Drive in Goleta, California, offering a blend of traditional American cuisine and craft beers. The establishment is open from 11:30 AM to 9:30 PM on weekdays, and until 10:00 PM on Fridays and Saturdays. It provides outdoor seating and free Wi-Fi, and it is notable for its on-site brewery and diverse menu that includes both classic and innovative dishes. Hollister Brewing Company accommodates reservations and takeout orders and is well-suited for group dining. The business offers a large parking lot but does not provide garage or valet parking. Reviews from customers indicate a mixed experience, with some praising the new menu and the quality of their food, particularly the Korean chicken wings, while others have highlighted poor service and unfriendly staff. The business holds a 3.5-star rating based on customer reviews.

review_info.review_text: Love their sandwiches, especially on Dutch bread! This location had a specific sandwich for SB, which is cool. Always super tasty and a lot so be prepared to share or save for another meal. Super fast service and convenient.

More so than seafood, vegetarian, or even Mexican food, the cream that rises to the top in Santa Barbara most consistently is...sandwiches! There is truly a pantheon of fine sandwich shops in our fair town and Ike's, with it's sole, somewhat squalid little location next to the 7-11 on Mission, has pushed it's way into that top tier. 

I've been there twice now and heard similar stories from friends and fam, and Ike's is the bomb. Their bread is fresh and tasty (I like the sourdough better than the Dutch Crunch, but you can't go wrong either way), the variety is hard to beat, the sauces are tasty, and they cook them oh so right. I've tried the steak sandwich and the three cheese and they were both on hit. 

Normally I'd dock a star or two for so many SF Giants references, or the weird little location, or the strange hours (closes at 6?), but the food and service are so legit that I'm not even going to go there. This spot is a legitimate contender with all the big boys in town - Valentinos, South Coast, Panino, and Sam's. Definitely worth picking up on your way to the Rose Garden or if you want to enjoy it in one of their creepy little booths staring at the weird ceiling.

The sandwiches here are awesome!  Although I despise the name of many of them (a lot of SF sports themed, while I'm an LA fan), I looked past that and enjoyed a couple sandwiches named after Giants players.  
The service was good, friendly and helpful.  Sandwiches were ready not too long after ordering them.  
The star of the sandwiches was the Dutch Crunch bread.  That is one of the most awesome breads for sandwiches, crunchy on the outside and soft interior. 
I'd definitely come back to try some of their other creations!

response: Ike’s Love & Sandwiches, located at 1936 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a popular vegan and vegetarian restaurant specializing in sandwiches. Open daily from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, the establishment offers a unique dining experience that caters to a variety of tastes, with a particular emphasis on their Dutch Crunch bread, which customers rave about for its crispy exterior and soft interior. The restaurant has garnered a 4.0-star rating from its patrons, with several reviews highlighting the fast and friendly service, the wide variety of sandwich options, and the delicious sauces that complement the fresh ingredients. One customer noted a special sandwich created specifically for Santa Barbara, and another praised the restaurant for its inclusion in the top tier of local sandwich shops, rivaling well-known establishments in the area. The restaurant provides takeout options, and while parking is available in a lot nearby, there is no outdoor seating. Despite the somewhat unconventional location and hours, the quality and taste of the food have earned it high praise and multiple five-star reviews.

review_info.review_text: Awesome service, nice ambiance and good service! Will come back in next trip to Santa Barbara.  Recommended local place hidden treasure!

I don't mind spending $13 on an interesting cocktail--particularly one that tastes good.  However, when it arrives quite low in the class, it is not only a disappointment, but also a rip off.  Drink arrived less than half full.  Waitress was a bit haughty, so I didn't want to deal with bringing it to her attention.

As a local I have loved Al's Alcazar and Milk & Honey since the beginning of time. Lamborghini Sliders are a must, Pork and Shrimp Tacos always. Menu has changed slightly over the years however, "Date with a Pig", salty sweetness is yum yum deliciousness always and forever. Shrimp and Grits and The Heat of Passion are all must have go too's. Sit in Nicole's section, she is heaven sent and her lighthearted sweet personality will make your week right!

response:
Alcazar Tapas Bar, situated at 1812 Cliff Dr in Santa Barbara, CA, is a popular tapas bar and restaurant known for its unique ambiance and diverse menu. The establishment offers a laid-back and trendy atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for groups and casual dining. Alcazar Tapas Bar is open from Tuesday to Saturday, with extended hours on Thursdays and Fridays. The bar does not provide garage or valet parking, but street and lot parking are available. Customers appreciate the outdoor seating and the absence of a reservation system, which adds to the relaxed dining experience.

Reviews highlight the bar's strengths, such as its excellent service and delicious food. A local reviewer praised the lamb sliders and shrimp tacos, recommending them as must-try dishes. Another visitor noted the bar's cozy and inviting atmosphere, promising to return during their next trip to Santa Barbara. However, one customer expressed dissatisfaction with the portion size of a cocktail, describing it as underfilled and overpriced. Despite this, the overall customer satisfaction is high, reflected in the 4.0 star rating.

source_info.name: Firehouse Subs
source_info.categories: Hot Dogs, Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Delis, Cheesesteaks

review_info.review_text: This is by FAR the best Sandwich spot in the World! Im very disappointed that it closed because it was a great spot for me and coworkers to go for lunch. Will there ever be another firehouse subs in Goleta/Santa Barbara?? Also I'm very curious as to what happened to the mural with the gaucho and the firemen hanging on the wall. Any information on either would be much appreciated!

FIREHOUSE SUBS IS CLOSED!

I was bummed when I stopped by for the Engineer sandwich, and they had closed their doors.   No forwarding address, so I guess business was not good at that location.

It's great! I got the #5 turkey bacon ranch. Super yummy. Owner is super friendly. I love that the sandwich comes with a pickle...I love pickles! Sandwich felt fresh too...higher quality than subway and Jimmy Johns!

response:
Firehouse Subs is a local fast-food restaurant located at 6530 Seville Rd., #103 in Isla Vista, CA. Specializing in hot dogs, sandwiches, and cheesesteaks, the restaurant offers a casual dining experience with outdoor seating available. Customers can enjoy free WiFi and the option for takeout. The restaurant operates from 10:30 AM to 11:00 PM on weekdays and closes earlier on Sundays at 10:00 PM. 

Reviews for Firehouse Subs are mixed but generally positive, with one customer praising it as "the best Sandwich spot in the World." Another customer, however, was disappointed to find the location closed, suggesting that business may have been challenging at this particular spot. A third review highlights the freshness and higher quality of the food compared to other fast-food chains, noting the friendly owner and the inclusion of pickles. The restaurant has received a high rating of 4.5 stars, reflecting its popularity among those who enjoy its menu offerings and atmosphere.

source_info.name: Wingman Rodeo - Montecito Street
source_info.categories: Salad, Sandwiches, Vegetarian, Restaurants, Chicken Wings

review_info.review_text: The food was great and even had leftovers.  Ordered through GrubHub because I wasn't aware that if you ordered on their website that they deliver as well, so order on their website.

While I understand that hardships have been a thing. 22 dollars for a six wing and a coke is a big step. I may be unaware of a shortage. Though I can't imagine it being this large of a loss. Explanation is welcome. Service is great, food or great. I want to come back.

I was skeptical due to the bone-in wing prices, but the reviews convinced me to splurge. 

Kale Cirtus salad with Thai peanut bone-in wings (came with 3 wings) was incredible. Kale is fresh, whole leaf Kale. Oranges (cuties) were fresh cut, not canned. Tots did not really belong, but hey, it's a topping! 

Strawberry Arbol Boneless boneless wings are incredible. Large, moist, and crispy boneless chicken + sauce on the side. Hot and worth it.

The Rodeo Fries were are as well. Crispy fries, tender Buffalo boneless chicken, chewy bacon. This should come with at least an option for blue cheese - not sure if this was overlooked on the online menu or just not an option. Will make sure to order a side next time.

response:
Wingman Rodeo - Montecito Street, located at 235 W Montecito St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a restaurant that specializes in salads, sandwiches, vegetarian options, and, notably, chicken wings. The establishment is open from 12:00 PM to 10:00 PM on Saturdays and Sundays, and from 4:00 PM to 10:00 PM on Thursdays and Fridays. Customers can park in a lot nearby, and the restaurant offers outdoor seating, making it a welcoming spot for group dining.

Reviews indicate that the food quality is high, with patrons praising the freshness of ingredients and the flavor of dishes such as the Thai peanut bone-in wings and the strawberry Arbol boneless wings. One reviewer mentioned enjoying the leftovers from their order. However, there is some concern about pricing, with one customer noting a significant increase in the cost of a six-wing order with a drink. Despite this, the overall sentiment is positive, and there are indications that customers value the experience and intend to return. The restaurant has earned a 4.0-star rating based on customer feedback.

review_info.review_text: Was very lucky to grab a box as they sell out in under a minute! I drove up from Ventura and it was well worth it! Absolutely fantastic flavors and the owner, Tommy, could not have been kinder or more appreciative! The whole experience was so easy and pleasant. The mochi donuts are such a unique treat and I must say I am craving them and cannot wait for Mor Doughnuts to return! Would love to see them setup a storefront where scoring a box wasn't so difficult. I will say though I was slightly disappointed though not to receive one of the beautiful shiny boxes like what I had seen in the photos.

I was excited to have gotten a box last Sunday. The flavors were so unique and the style of the donuts were new to me and so very delicious. In addition to a wonderful product, the owner seems to be a wonderful person. I was having a bad day and my short interaction with Tommy was enough to turn my day around. Thanks for the kindness and the introduction to mochi donuts! Highly recommend you keep trying to get a box if you haven't already. It is well worth the effort :)
AMAZING donuts!!! The best flavors!! Tommy nailed the flavors and has hands down the best customer service I've seen! You've missed out if you're in SB and not grabbing these donuts!!!

response:
Kin Bakeshop, a popular local business located at 3404 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is celebrated for its unique and delicious mochi donuts. This pop-up restaurant operates on Saturdays from 10:00 to 11:00, offering a limited and highly sought-after selection of donuts that quickly sell out. Customers frequently praise the exceptional flavors and the charming owner, Tommy, who is noted for his kindness and engaging personality.

Reviews consistently highlight the difficulty in obtaining a box of donuts, as they often sell out within minutes. Despite the challenge, customers find the experience rewarding, with many describing the flavors as unique and delicious. The business does not offer outdoor seating or reservations, but it does provide takeout service, which is highly convenient for its customers. The absence of a physical storefront is a minor disappointment for some, who wish for easier access to these delightful treats. Overall, Kin Bakeshop has earned a perfect 5-star rating from its customers, who highly recommend the experience.

source_info.name: Ty Lounge
source_info.categories: Bars, Nightlife, Tapas/Small Plates, Tapas Bars, Restaurants, Lounges

review_info.review_text: Five stars for the service we received from Emilio our server. I recommend going for happy hour as the prices are better!

The food here is better than at Bella Vista, the resort's flagship restaurant.  They have a huge TV that they were playing sports on so it was loud.  Otherwise, the place looks cool and has a great vibe.  I think you can also sit out on the patio.  Would eat here again.
Excellent service great place to slide into for a drink and / or a bite! Burgers excellent always. Always 5 stars from Four Seasons and Ty Warner.

response:
Ty Lounge, located at 1260 Channel Drive in Santa Barbara, CA, offers a diverse array of experiences, encompassing bars, nightlife, tapas, and lounges. The establishment is known for its upscale and classy ambience, which has earned it a 4.0-star rating from customers. Ty Lounge operates with extended hours, closing as late as 1 AM on certain days, catering to both daytime and nighttime patrons.

The business provides complimentary WiFi and has valet parking available, ensuring a convenient and comfortable experience for guests. Outdoor seating is also available, enhancing the atmosphere with a pleasant dining option. Service at Ty Lounge has been particularly praised, with one reviewer highlighting the excellent service provided by Emilio, their server. Another reviewer noted the excellent burgers and recommended the happy hour menu for better pricing.

The establishment has been commended for its vibe and the quality of its food, which some patrons have found superior to other well-known local restaurants. However, it is worth noting that the place can get loud due to sports broadcasts on a large TV. Overall, Ty Lounge stands out as a go-to spot for groups, offering a mix of casual and upscale dining experiences.

review_info.review_text: Really overpriced, greasy fried tacos. There is a good amount of meat inside but the meat isn't so tasty. We really had no other options so had to eat this. Left me feeling bloated and unsatisfied. Would not recommend this place.

I decided to try this spot today. I ordered a rajas burrito. Had crazy Flavor! 

The menu is well rounded. From burgers to Nachos. All the food looked pretty good coming out. My burrito came with Gauc and sour cream. 

I asked for the spiciest salsa. She gave all 3 to try. I'd have to say the red/orange Salsa had the best flavor and was the spiciest. Not really over the top. All were good. 

Was a beautiful day to sit outside in SB.

Crazy Jim's made you makes you feel good crazy. Don't miss this amazing tacos especially the fish taco and the L Pastore taco and steak and shrimp taco and the Rahas tacos. All amazing with a negro modelo.

response: Crazy Jim's Tacos Y Más, located at 505 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a Tex-Mex and Mexican restaurant that specializes in tacos and offers a diverse menu including burgers and nachos. It is open from 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM on weekdays and until 9:00 PM on Sundays, with extended hours on Fridays and Saturdays until 9:00 PM. The restaurant provides free WiFi and outdoor seating, and it is known for its takeout service and suitability for groups. Customers have noted that the burritos and tacos offer a variety of flavors, with some praising the spiciness and taste of the food, while others have found the tacos to be overpriced and greasy. Despite mixed reviews, the restaurant maintains an overall rating of 4.0 stars based on customer feedback.

review_info.review_text:
Here we are after following a food blogger for the past month now. First, the place has a its  own character. Old and charming in a rustic way. All raw wood, no paint. It was like a movie set. What with the bikers as main characters. We were looking forward to the foot long tri tip sandwich but I think we made a mistake ordering. What came was like a six inch tri tip sandwich! I would have loved to take a photo a loooonnnngggg sandwich much like what the food blogger had. . Now, the beef was kind of dry and I think we got the very end of the tri tip. Not as tasty or juicy as I was expecting. Next time I order, I will make sure to say that I would like the middle part of the meat and not the end.
I turned my attention to the vegetable salad and onion rings . I like the vegetable salad because the veggies were grilled and the  cranberry dressing was light and refreshing.  I wish they could have placed more.  
The onion rings  which we excitedly waited for were big and good too. We had to box the rest of it because it was too big for us.

Overall , it is a regular sandwich place in a picnic setting. Relaxed and beautiful in its simplicity. 

If you are showing friends around, I think  this is a good place to consider:

We came to this famous "old stagecoach stop turned eatery" on a cold winter day but the vibe here was super warm!   But if the vibe along isn't enough to warm your heart, the ginormous Tri-tip sandwich will certainly warm your stomach! 

The meat was done to perfection and the bun was soft... and they give you so much that the two halves of the bun hardly close!  

If you buy the $13 sandwich, you'd have to eat out in open tables. There's a restaurant but hard to get into. 

The ambiance is rustic, casual and relaxing. Parking can be difficult as this famous joint is super popular!  
CHECK THEIR HOURS before you come (they are not open every day like other restaurants) so you don't end up driving the distance and get disappointed. Lastly, my guess is this place is more enjoyable in the summertime as the shady tree-lines areas can be cold in the winter.
Although the food was good and the setting was nice. I got food poisoning after eating either the chili cheese fries or the Tavern burger.

response:
Cold Spring Tavern, located at 5995 Stagecoach Rd in Santa Barbara, California, is a charming establishment that blends traditional American cuisine with a rustic, relaxed ambiance. Known for its historical significance as an old stagecoach stop, the tavern offers a unique dining experience with raw wooden decor, evoking a sense of nostalgia and character. The restaurant operates with limited hours, closing on Mondays and Thursdays, and staying open late on weekends. Parking is available on the street or in a lot, though it can be challenging due to the tavern's popularity.

Cold Spring Tavern is well-regarded for its hearty portions, particularly the famous foot-long tri-tip sandwich, although some diners have noted that the sandwich can vary in size and quality. The tavern also offers a variety of other menu items, such as grilled vegetable salads and onion rings, which have received positive feedback. Outdoor seating is a standout feature, providing a serene picnic-like setting amidst shady trees, making it a perfect spot for casual dining or group gatherings.

While the tavern generally receives high praise for its food and atmosphere, one reviewer reported an unfortunate incident of food poisoning, likely from the chili cheese fries or Tavern burger. Despite this isolated incident, the overall customer satisfaction is high, with the tavern earning a 4.5-star rating. The establishment provides a welcoming and warm environment, ideal for both locals and tourists looking for a taste of authentic, traditional American fare.

source_info.name: Corktree Cellars Wine Bar & Bistro
source_info.categories: Bars, Wine Bars, American (New), Nightlife, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Our first visit and certainly won't be out last, wonderful staff and even better food. We just went in for a light dinner but the tapas servings were huge. Honestly the best burger that I had in a very long time. 5/5

The dream team is back! Had dinner here the other night and it was simply epic. Best chicken piccata I've ever had. Cooked to perfection, lightly breaded, unbelievable lemon/butter/caper sauce. Asparagus and brussell sprout medley cooked to al dente perfection. Perfect, generous but not outrageous portions. Awesome service at the bar, friendly, welcoming general manager running the show. The home run chef is back and the management and staff are dialed in, so if you haven't visited The Cork recently, as was the case with me, get on in there and enjoy because their game is seriously elevated

Everything we ordered was delicious! The brunch menu has a good variety as well as the lunch and dinner menu. We went on a Sunday and we were seated quickly. 
The food came out hot and fresh. Definitely recommend the Seafood Eggs Benedict, Seafood tacos, Huevos Rancheros, Avocado Toast, and Lobster Bisque. The drinks were also made wonderfully. 
A nice and chill atmosphere and the owners are super nice! Would come again.

response:
Corktree Cellars Wine Bar & Bistro, located at 910 Linden Ave in Carpinteria, CA, is a highly-rated establishment offering a blend of American cuisine and wine bar experiences. Known for its diverse offerings, the venue serves as a go-to spot for groups and casual dining, earning a 4.0-star rating from its clientele. The restaurant is open daily from 11:30 AM to 9:00 PM, catering to those seeking a dining experience that extends into the evening.

Customers praise the restaurant for its excellent service and the quality of its food, particularly mentioning standout dishes like the tapas, burgers, and seafood options. One review highlighted the best burger the reviewer had in a long time, while another lauded the chicken piccata as the best they've ever tasted, cooked to perfection with generous but not overwhelming portions. The restaurant also provides outdoor seating and takeout services, enhancing its appeal to a variety of diners. With a warm and welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff, and a strong emphasis on quality, Corktree Cellars Wine Bar & Bistro stands out as a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

review_info.review_text:
Such a cute location!! Food was incredible and was so cozy. Not busy at all when I went so I hope they get enough business

I got the Penne Alla Boscaiola. It was mushroom, bacon and cream sauce. Absolutely to die for 
 The bread was also so incredible. I ate so much haha but you could definitely tell the bread was fresh!' 

Must come!
Highly recommend

Amazing experience at this adorable, cozy and delicious restaurant just up the road from the main strip in Montecito! Pane e Vino is tucked away in the corner of a cute little shopping center on E Valley Road, just a quick minute off the 101 Fwy. It has outdoor, patio and inside dining, beautiful setting. We went for lunch on a Saturday and it was quiet and peaceful, honestly far better than waiting for one of the crowded, expensive spots on the main drag. Food was off the charts good! Italian owned and operated for 32 years, they use locally sourced fresh produce and high quality ingredients. The olive oil was rich and delicious, it was quality. The chef custom made chicken piccatta off menu for my dad and it was the best I've ever tasted. I had the spinach salad and added grilled shrimp. Their pancetta and grilled shrimp were amazingly good.. this was the BEST salad I have ever had. Service was amazing.. loved our serving staff. This is a local's favorite that we stumbled upon and it was an absolute gem! Bravo Pane e Vino for providing a first class experience across the board! Worth every penny!

Another reviewer said they were "sized up" upon arrival. My sentiments exactly.  I guess if you don't arrive in a Range Rover, you aren't worth the trouble.  Nauseating..... really!  We had high hopes for this place on our anniversary weekend. We arrived and were sat by a friendly bus boy, then we sat for another 15 minutes without acknowledgement from any server.  No water/bread.... nada!  I was a server for 12 years so I get being busy, but there was plenty of help on staff and only a few tables.  We finally got the attention of an apathetic, rather aloof server, while what seemed to be the manager/owner continued to schmooze the bougie table (ya know the kind that looks like they've walked out of a J.Crew commercial) right next to us without so much as a glance our way.  I find this type of behavior from an owner unacceptable.  So for just north of a $100 you'll get unfriendly staff, subpar dry bread, underwhelming salad, & teeny portions of mediocre food.   After asking for our check, which the owner took, then we again sat waiting, as he schmoozed the same table, holding our check and not running our card. Still, we tipped 15% & did not complain as I'm sure it wouldn't have been received.  I certainly won't ever be back.  We were going to order dessert and coffee, but went down to road to give our money to Ca' Dario, where they were happy to see us, the dessert was exquisite and the service wasn't pretentious crap!  Left $50 tip on a $50 tab there, too.  Save yourself the trouble and go there, or McDonald's.... either way, you'll have a better experience.

response:
Pane E Vino is an Italian restaurant located at 1482 E Valley Rd in Montecito, CA. It is well-known for its cozy ambiance and delicious cuisine, which has earned it a 4.0-star rating from customers. The restaurant operates from 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM every day of the week. It offers outdoor seating and the convenience of making reservations, though it does not provide WiFi and lacks street or garage parking options. Customers can enjoy takeout options and the restaurant is known to accommodate large groups.

Positive reviews highlight the exceptional quality of the food and the intimate, charming setting. One diner praised the Penne Alla Boscaiola, describing it as "to die for," and another visitor, after trying the chef's custom-made chicken piccata, declared it the best they had ever tasted. These reviews underscore the restaurant's commitment to using locally sourced, high-quality ingredients. However, a negative review points out poor service and unfriendly staff, indicating that while the food may be excellent, the dining experience can vary widely depending on the service provided. Despite this, Pane E Vino stands out as a local favorite, offering a unique dining experience for those seeking authentic Italian cuisine.

review_info.review_text: They used to have a cart by the library and a location inside the University Center. They closed August 2011. There's now a Wahoo's Fish Taco store.

Why would anyone give Chilitos 5 stars when they have garbage ass  food and Super Cucas is just a 10 minute walk away in IV? Because they serve pitchers of beer. That's why. What the fuck else are you going to do when you have some general ed 7 pm Theater class? You're going to hit up Chilitos and get fucked up. That's what.


Note: Freebirds is overated garbo by the way for all of you noobs out there. So yourself a favor and get a ranchero burrito from Super Cucas. Your boner/wet vag will thank met later.

I got a basic chicken burrito.  Somehow, it ended up being $7.07.

The guys working there were okay - it was the burrito that was so utterly disappointing. After handling the burrito, the tortilla left a powdery coating on my hands.  I couldn't even tell if there was chicken in the burrito after a couple bites, and I couldn't tell if there was salsa in it until I'd worked my way well into it.  And really, those pinto beans?  It made for a filling burrito, but I wanted a good burrito.

I give it credit for not being nasty - it was just bland, and the powdery tortilla made me feel like I'd just handled a bag of cocaine when I'd finished.

response: Chilitos Restaurant, a Mexican cuisine establishment located in Goleta, CA, has garnered mixed reviews from its patrons, reflecting an overall rating of 3.0 stars. The restaurant previously operated a cart by the library and a location within the University Center until August 2011, when it closed down. One customer appreciated Chilitos for its affordable pitchers of beer, which made it a popular spot for students looking to socialize, despite the quality of the food being questioned. Another reviewer found the basic chicken burrito to be overpriced and underwhelming, noting issues with the tortilla's quality and the blandness of the meal. Chilitos offers takeout services and is good for group outings, with outdoor seating available. However, it no longer has a physical presence in its former locations.

review_info.review_text:
This place is incredible!

So clean!  Fresh food, wonderful choices.

So coming back there!

Beautiful located, a choice of sitting inside or outside.  THANK YOU!

I think fusion-style Thai food.
I found something in the food and they changed immediately. But not too sorry and not offer anything. I wanted to refund but just eat.
Anyway, every food is fine.

Well Date of Visit : December 19, 2021 and searching for an open Restaurant in Santa Barbara after 8:00pm is kind of difficult !! So what I noticed is lots of restaurants close fairly early and driving up and down the street plus walking in asking if restaurants are opened !! And most close early !! So Finally found this Thai Restaurant opened past 8:30pm and I walk in and was seated right away and it was really slow because it was 43 degrees outside and freezing so I guess no one wants to be outside eating !! Well for us we were fairly hungry and needed some food in our stomach !! As a foodie I always enjoy trying new restaurants and eating at new places !! So I Decided on ordering the Pan Thai Noodles and I have to say it is one of the more popular dishes here !! Cooked well and flavorful !! Next I got some appetizers which were the delicious Spring Rolls which they cut in pieces for you to dip into there delicious Peanut Sauce which comes on the side !! Those spring rolls were yummy !! Last I got the Red meat Wonton Soup which hit the spot !! Tasted pretty dang good !! I also noticed the decor was decorated with a lot of elephants around and I guess it's the symbol for this Restaurant !! But I do suggest you give it a try and enjoy the delicious Thai food they serve here !! One more thing the parking was not bad but you have to park on the side street and the first 90 Minutes are Free !! Well my overall experience was good and I definitely recommend this Restaurant to everyone to try  !! And if I happen to be in Santa Barbara again I might have to stop in once again !!

response: Siam Elephant is a Thai restaurant located at 509 Linden Ave in Carpinteria, California. It is known for its clean and fresh food, offering a variety of Thai dishes and fusion-style options. The restaurant provides a pleasant dining experience with both indoor and outdoor seating, making it suitable for groups and casual gatherings. Customers can enjoy a cozy atmosphere with decor featuring elephant motifs, symbolizing the restaurant's theme. Siam Elephant is open from 12:00 to 21:30 on Saturdays and Sundays, and from 17:00 to 21:30 on weekdays. The restaurant supports reservations, takeout services, and offers parking on nearby streets with free options available for the first 90 minutes. While some customers have noted the need for immediate attention to specific food preferences, overall reviews highlight the delicious flavors and the restaurant's ability to cater to late diners. With a rating of 4.5 stars, Siam Elephant is recommended for those seeking authentic and flavorful Thai cuisine in a comfortable setting.

source_info.name: Belmond El Encanto
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Hotels & Travel

review_info.review_text:
This is easily
One of the worst hotels we have ever stayed at.
Terrible room service !
I mean the worst!
The room is nice but the electricity goes out if we turn in the microwave ... yes you read that right.
There is a microwave and we were using it to warm a cookie.
After the ceiling failed in my room with a rain leak, causing damage and injury, the staff ignored my complaints. Now they are stalking me on LinkedIn. Stay away from this place!!!

This place has gone way down hill. My current room is cramped and dirty--the TV and telephone don't work. They emailed me a request for mini bar items-none are present. The mattress is broken and the rugs are dirty. Not very Belmond. Covid I guess.

I totally believe Denise below. Service has way changed here.

Update: It started raining in my room and I had to move in the middle of the night. Front Desk wanted to send an engineer to "fix the roof" instead of finding a new room. This place is a disaster.

response:
Belmond El Encanto, located at 800 Alvarado Pl in Santa Barbara, CA, is a multifaceted establishment offering hotel accommodations, event planning services, and dining options. Open from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM on most days, with extended hours on Fridays and Saturdays until 11:00 PM, the hotel provides a variety of amenities including outdoor seating and takeout services, but lacks parking options on-site. The hotel allows guests to make reservations and offers paid WiFi.

However, recent customer reviews have been overwhelmingly negative, highlighting significant issues with room quality and service. One reviewer encountered a malfunctioning microwave causing electrical issues, while another faced a ceiling collapse due to a leak, resulting in personal injury. Additionally, complaints about room cleanliness, broken furniture, and malfunctioning electronics have been reported. The hotel's staff response to these incidents has been criticized, with one guest alleging that staff members continued to contact them after their stay. These reviews suggest a decline in the hotel's standards, prompting potential guests to exercise caution.

review_info.review_text: Service was great and friendly. We were greeted immediately and seated very quickly. We had the classic eggs Benedict with hash browns and it was delicious! The waffles were tasty. The pancakes were a bit different, they tasted as if they were made with a sourdough batter? I could be wrong but regardless the food was really good. 10/10 would recommend. Oh, the coffee is delicious, a real cup of Joe!
Nothing to write home about. Good diner food - pancakes, eggs, etc. but ambiance was meh. The main stand out was how great the service was.

Made a return visit to Santa Barbara, can't get enough of this picturesque city! Decided to stop at Sunshine Cafe, Yelp pics of their food items looked cool! Ordered breakfast burrito, they use whole pinto beans which gives the burrito an authentic taste. Potatoes on side with green onion topping were very good. BLT sandwich very hearty, and coffee nice and strong! Recommended!

response:
SB Sunshine Cafe, located at 3514 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a popular dining spot known for its American cuisine, particularly breakfast and brunch. The cafe is open from 7:00 AM to 2:30 PM Tuesday through Sunday, offering a cozy and casual atmosphere that caters well to groups. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating, free WiFi, and takeout options, while parking is available on the street or in a nearby lot.

The cafe has received a high rating of 4.5 stars, with multiple reviews highlighting the excellent service and food quality. One reviewer praised the eggs Benedict and waffles, noting the unique flavor of the pancakes made with a possible sourdough batter. Another customer appreciated the classic diner fare like pancakes and eggs, with special mention of the coffee. A return visitor recommended the breakfast burrito, made with whole pinto beans, and the hearty BLT sandwich. Overall, the cafe offers a welcoming and satisfying dining experience with commendable service and authentic flavors.

review_info.review_text: Went tonight to find the place closed  - looks like for good. Everything was gone but tables and chairs. Sad - it became our go to Italian place.

This place is amazing. If you want great authentic Italian and warm friendly service... this is where you need to be. It blows my mind more people don't know how good this place is. Top 3 Italian in town for sure: the complimentary bread is amazing. The wine... delicious and my tummy is never unhappy leaving here. JUST COME!! You will not regret it :) love you basil's!!

Off the beaten path but well worth a visit!

Had lunch here today. The sweet server brought out some soft foccacia bread. Combo pizza was hot and loaded with fresh toppings. Egg plant parmesan was Panko breaded and topped with a rich tomato sauce with delicious pasta on the side. 

Shout out to Rosemary...thank you!

response:
Basil's Italian, located at 608 Anacapa St in Santa Barbara, California, is a diverse dining establishment offering a menu that includes sandwiches, deli items, pizza, and traditional Italian cuisine. The restaurant is open daily, with extended hours on Fridays and Saturdays, catering to a variety of customer needs. It features outdoor seating and offers free WiFi, making it a convenient spot for casual dining and group gatherings. Basil's Italian also supports reservations and takeout services.

Customer reviews highlight the restaurant's warm and friendly service, with many praising its authentic Italian dishes and complimentary bread. One reviewer particularly appreciated the combo pizza, which was noted for its fresh toppings, while another enjoyed the eggplant parmesan. Despite these positive reviews, a later visit found the restaurant closed, leaving a sense of disappointment among regulars who considered it a favorite Italian dining spot. The business has maintained a high rating of 4.5 stars based on customer feedback, reflecting its generally positive reception despite some closures.

source_info.name: Phresh Teas
source_info.categories: Bubble Tea, Restaurants, Taiwanese, Coffee & Tea, Food

review_info.review_text: I usually enjoy the drinks here. This time I ordered a strawberry milk with boba. However whenever I would take a sip I would find small pieces of plastic. I enjoyed the drink but couldn't finish due to the number of plastic.
Service, everything time I order I wait 1 hour to get my food, after showing up 30 after placing my order or its get canceled online.  So disappointing

From the time we got there to getting out drink....it took 30 min.  There was a group of 6 girls who ordered before us, only one person working the register and making the Boba. I felt really bad for the employee because she looked stressed. I did like how she told us it would take her 10 min before she took our order because she wanted to make the order for the big group before us. Ordering food was faster- seems like they had at least 2 people cooking. I ordered the green tea peach tea with lychee jelly and lychee and strawberry popping boba, but my order came out wrong and I didn't want to wait for her to change the order because it probably would have had to wait another half an hour. I will know my wife's order also got messed up as well. The flavor of the green tea Peach was good oh, but the popping Boba had some that tasted bad. I'm giving this place at to starve because of the long wait, and the popping boba tasting off.

response: Phresh Teas, located at 5599 Hollister Ave, Unit B & C in Goleta, CA, is a restaurant specializing in Bubble Tea, Taiwanese cuisine, and other coffee and tea offerings. Operating from 11:30 AM to 8:30 PM daily, except for Mondays when they are closed, the establishment offers outdoor seating and free WiFi. Customers can also opt for takeout services. However, recent reviews indicate some issues with service and product quality. A customer reported finding plastic pieces in their strawberry milk with boba, while another experienced long wait times for their orders, leading to dissatisfaction. Another review highlighted extended waiting periods for drink orders due to limited staff, resulting in incorrect orders and poor-tasting popping boba. Despite these issues, the restaurant maintains a 4.0-star rating, suggesting that while there are areas for improvement, patrons generally find enjoyment in their offerings.

source_info.name: Cafe 154
source_info.address: 4151 Foothill Rd Building A Main Fl, Bldg A

review_info.review_text:
I came here for the Axxess deal: free first regular latte or drop coffee. First of all, way to use the Axxess card, Cafe 154! Many businesses are skimping out, but a full on free item with no purchase requirement is a great hook.

I was planning on only getting the latte, but upon entering the cafe, I was confronted with a small case of high quality pastries. Immediately after I began gazing at the treats, a friendly woman came up and asked me if I had any questions about the pastries. I asked if she had any suggestions, and she smiled and sighed exaggeratedly as if to say what a hard choice it would be because they were all so good. She recommended the berry scone or the croissants. I was eyes a generously almond/powdered sugar encrusted croissant, and ordered that, along with a latte. The same woman asked if I'd like to add a syrup for the difference in price (deal was for only the regular latte). Normally I normally would decline, but this was "homemade" syrup, so I got the dark chocolate.
