Best latte and croissant I've had in Santa Barbara! The chocolate syrup was rich and perfectly sweet; the almond croissant was both heavily crusted and filled with almond paste, and not greasy like many croissants. So delicious!! I ended up paying $5 total

Great products, great staff, reasonable prices for a high quality cafe.
Great place, food is outstanding and Bulletproof Coffee prepared perfectly.  lovely outdoor seating and super friendly staff.  Someone with high standards is clearly in charge!

They serve coffee using Green Star coffee beans! They sell sandwiches, salads, smoothies and coffee drinks at reasonable prices. Got an iced latte for only $2.89 and the espresso is strong and flavorful!

response: Cafe 154, located at 4151 Foothill Rd Building A Main Fl in Santa Barbara, California, is a highly-rated café and restaurant known for its quality offerings and friendly service. The café operates from 6:30 AM to 6:00 PM on weekdays, closing earlier on Fridays. It provides free WiFi, outdoor seating, and takeout options, making it a versatile spot for various occasions. Customers appreciate the free latte offer through the Axxess card, which highlights the café's customer-friendly policies. The café is praised for its delicious pastries, particularly the almond croissants and berry scones, as well as its coffee, including the dark chocolate syrup and Bulletproof Coffee. One reviewer noted that the iced latte was particularly affordable at $2.89. The café uses high-quality Green Star coffee beans and offers a variety of items like sandwiches, salads, and smoothies at reasonable prices. With a 4.0-star rating, Cafe 154 stands out for its exceptional food and welcoming staff.

source_info.name: Flor De Maiz
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Mexican, Bars, Cocktail Bars

review_info.review_text:
This restaurant, hands down, has the best complimentary chips and salsa I've ever had. This alone would make me want to come back! The green salsa is surprisingly creamy yet still hot. I'm still thinking about the chips as I write this post. 

The tacos de camaron were amazing as well. The shrimp included in the tacos were almost the size of my palm!! They were very generous with the amount of shrimp per taco too. The rice was alright--definitely not the highlight of the show but did it's job.

The taquitos de pato en mole coloradito was (duck taquitos with mole) was definitely interesting. The duck was shredded and fried into taquitos, and the mole was slightly bitter. I'm glad we were able to try this but I'm not sure if we'll reorder again.

The esquites Mexicanos was delicious. The corn was perfectly seasoned with cojita cheese and sour cream. Definitely the fanciest esquites I've had. 

Overall a great experience! The food was satisfying and the service was friendly. I'd recommend coming while the sun is about to set so you can enjoy your meal with a beautiful view.
What a beautiful restaurant and the food was beyond amazing! You can taste the fresh ingredients and the customer service was stellar. Definitely coming back for more!

Why did it take me so long to finally come to Flor De Maiz? This is a great place to meet friends, bring family and for date nights! 

 I love that the location is near the water and has both beautiful indoor and outdoor seating! They have an extensive drink menu with SO MANY margarita choices and signature cocktails.

We started off with the Margarita Sauylita which was a tasty pineapple mango margarita and it came it with a cute pineapple glass and garnish. 10/10! My boyfriend got the Jamaica which was also good! I would love to go back and try more of their drinks because there are so many great options!

As we waited, they brought out chips and salsa. Now the green salsa served here was by FAR the greatest salsa I have ever had in my entire life. It was so creamy...I just need a bottle of that to go. 

As for food, I had the Mole Negro con Pollo which the waiter said was one the customers favorites and it did not disappoint!!! The chicken and the rice was amazing, the mole was rich and creamy and the plantains were PERFECTLY ripe and sweet. I loved this dish so much.

The service was amazing as well, shout-out to Adrian! I need to come back here on my next visit to Santa Barbara!

response: Flor De Maiz is a highly-rated restaurant and cocktail bar located in Santa Barbara, California. Known for its diverse menu of Mexican cuisine, the establishment offers both indoor and outdoor seating, providing a versatile dining experience for groups and couples alike. The restaurant is particularly popular for its complimentary chips and salsa, with customers raving about the green salsa's unique blend of creaminess and spiciness. Highlights from the menu include the tacos de camaron, featuring generously portioned shrimp, and the Mole Negro con Pollo, which is praised for its rich, creamy flavors. Additionally, the restaurant boasts a wide selection of margaritas and signature cocktails, further enhancing the dining experience. Flor De Maiz is open from mid-morning to late evening, with reservations accepted and street parking available. The ambiance is described as trendy and romantic, making it an ideal spot for date nights and social gatherings.

source_info.name: Rincon Brewery
source_info.categories: Breweries, Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Food, Pubs, Pizza

review_info.review_text:
Rincon is so conveniently located on Pardall that I'm surprised I hadn't gone more often when I still lived in IV. 

Drinks here were amazingly refreshing after a hot day at the beach, price was just right, and employees here are friendly and helpful. 

I love their assortment of games (giant Jenga, giant Connect 4, and even a knock-off Go Fish) because it makes it so easy to hang out here with your friends while sipping on a cold one. 

I've only tried the kombucha and each sip was cold and crisp. Fortunately they have a private parking lot (rare for a business in IV), making it easy to come back.

Still can't believe Gio's is gone but Rincon is a satisfactory replacement. Most of their beer pitches are $17.99 which is kinda pricey, especially when the IV pale ale is good and only $9.99! I like how they are prepared for customers to play games with plastic cups + ping pong balls available! We brought die and played games at a table which was easy as the place was pretty empty on a Saturday afternoon. They don't wristband like Gio's used to.
Beer tastes great. Massive upgrade to Giovannis. Coming from an old Gaucho who hates a lot of the Isla Vista changes. This is a good one though.

response: Rincon Brewery, located at 6583 Pardall Rd in Isla Vista, CA, is a versatile establishment that combines the offerings of a brewery, restaurant, and bar. It is known for its refreshing drinks, particularly its beers, which have been praised for their quality and variety, with prices varying from affordable to slightly higher options. The brewery has a private parking lot, a notable amenity given the scarcity of such facilities in the area. Customers appreciate the outdoor seating and the availability of games, like giant Jenga and Connect 4, which enhance the social atmosphere. The friendly staff and convenient location near the beach also contribute to the positive experience. While some visitors find certain beer prices to be on the higher side, others consider it a significant improvement over previous establishments in the area. Rincon Brewery is open on Sundays from 1:00 PM to 4:00 PM and offers takeout services.

source_info.name: Padaro Beach Grill
source_info.categories: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Seafood, Burgers, Tacos, Sandwiches, Mexican, Bars, Food, Beer Bar, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Nightlife

review_info.review_text: I give the food here 5/5 very delicious I've had their burgers and sandwiches. Their sweet potato fries are really good. In my opinion the food is pricey but if your hungry and don't mind spending a bit more by all means yes. But well their service there is sometimes great sometime not so great just depends who takes your order. But the food and view are great.

What's a surprising treat. We were road-tripping and wanted to grab some fresh affordable fish and ended up at Padrino's. Their fresh fish was perfectly matched by the ambiance as you could sit outside close to the ocean. Casual, good quality, and beautiful! Highly recommend!

What an adorable place!!! Loved the Ambience, the beautiful outside seating, the cozy and warm fire pits and the delicious food! I got the Turkey burger with caramelized onions and avocados, OMG!! My taste buds were bursting with joy!! Love it and can't wait to go back on a warmer day!!

response:
Padaro Beach Grill, located at 3765 Santa Claus Ln in Carpinteria, California, is a versatile dining establishment that caters to a wide range of culinary preferences and social needs. As a place that serves American (Traditional), Seafood, Burgers, Tacos, and Mexican dishes, it is also known for its extensive beverage selection, including Beer and Juice Bars & Smoothies. The restaurant operates from 11:00 AM to 20:00 PM, with varying hours on different days of the week.

Customers appreciate the restaurant's free WiFi, outdoor seating, and the option for takeout and reservations. A notable aspect highlighted by reviews is the food quality, with one reviewer praising the deliciousness of their burgers and sandwiches, and another highlighting the fresh fish and ambiance while dining al fresco close to the ocean. The restaurant's casual yet upscale atmosphere and cozy outdoor seating have also been positively noted. However, service inconsistency has been mentioned, with quality varying based on the server. Overall, Padaro Beach Grill maintains a strong reputation with a 4.5-star rating, reflecting its appeal to both casual diners and those looking for a more refined dining experience.

source_info.name: Les Marchands Restaurant & Wine Shop
source_info.categories: Nightlife, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Food, Venues & Event Spaces, American (New), Wine Bars, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Had the chicken and waffles and it was surprisingly good! Waffles were perfectly prepped and the chicken was the nice mix of crispy yet moist. It did come with honey which was unexpected for me since I'm from the East Coast and would normally have some delish Canadian Maple syrup.

Service was quick and friendly. Very efficient. Loved having brunch on the outside patio. Cute little location with great ambiance.

The only thing I'd recommend is to work on the cold brew coffee I got. Not sure if it was how it was prepped but the coffee was off (tasted very light).

This was the best brunch experience we had in Santa Barbara during this weekend. Grace was fantastic and beautifully described all of the dishes we asked about. Service is on point and OMG get the smoked pork shoulder- to die for. Also, maybe the best Bloody Mary I've ever had. Reservations encouraged, definitely a must see.

It really is ABOUT THE WINE:  

In an area such as the Santa Barbara waterfront, where wine offerings are a plenty, make time to stop at Les Marchands.   This wine bar goes beyond a tasting room and is as good as it gets if you're looking for one stop offering of impeccable service, knowledgable staff, gracious hospitality, outdoor patio, and a wine list that represents the California footprint with expertise.  

Food pairings are a delight when reading up on their menu, you'll be excited to read the names of many hard to find, stunning wines from local family owned, small production vitners as a common offering at this wine bar, i.e. Bryan Babcock's "Ocean's Ghost" Pinot Noir (a 92 point effort on the 2016 bottling).  

The only crime is that I live so far away and can only enjoy when I return home to California!

response:
Les Marchands Restaurant & Wine Shop, situated at 131 Anacapa St, Ste B in Santa Barbara, CA, is a multi-faceted establishment offering a blend of dining, wine tasting, and event planning services. The restaurant is open from 11:00 AM to late hours on most weekdays, catering to various culinary preferences and social settings. It features a valet parking service and offers a romantic, intimate, trendy, upscale, and casual ambiance, making it suitable for diverse groups. The outdoor seating is particularly praised for its atmosphere. 

Customers have highlighted the quality of both food and service, with one reviewer particularly impressed by the chicken and waffles, noting the pleasant mix of crispy and moist chicken. Another review commends the brunch experience, especially praising the smoked pork shoulder and the Bloody Mary. The restaurant's wine selection is also highly regarded, with one reviewer emphasizing the excellence of the wine offerings and the knowledgeable staff. However, a minor critique was mentioned regarding the quality of the cold brew coffee, which was described as tasting light. Overall, Les Marchands is highly recommended for its exceptional dining and wine experiences.

source_info.name: Santa Barbara Harbor & Seafood Festival
source_info.categories: Food, Local Flavor, Seafood, Arts & Entertainment, Shopping, Festivals, Restaurants, Arts & Crafts

review_info.review_text: Beach shack for takeout on one side and casual dine-in restaurant on the other side.  We had the ceviche, albacore tuna melt and ahi tacos. All were very good and we'd get them again! Ordered the bartender special cocktail - good but a little pricey and served in a martini glass so not a lot of cocktail.  All in all, a fun place with decent food.

We flew to LAX 1 day before, and drove 2 hours from LA to Santa Barbara which is our trip main itinerary. There are several tents selling merchandise along from parking lot to pier. On the pier, you can get fresh sea urchin, crabs, and spiky lobsters. Lobsters each weighs over 1 lb to almost 2 lbs. You just hand picked and paid by the weight which they accept credit card. Then you proceed to cook station for fee of $5 and waited for about an hour. We also got a plate of paella, a cup of clam chowder for our lunch. Initially wanted to try fresh oysters a dozen for $25 but the line was too long. There's ceviche, taco, street corn, etc. Once we got our food, we settled down near the beach picnic table under palm trees. 

All and all, the experience was great. Enjoyed driving along beach despite the LA traffic.

Over crowded festival with overpriced food. I was mainly interested in tasting some fresh uni.  There were a couple of venders selling live uni but most of them had hardly any eggs in it.  I paid one for $15 and it was okay but not good enough to get another one.  The live fish and lobsters, after purchasing them, you have to take them to a different tent to cook for you and there was a long line.  I had to wait for 30 minutes for jambalaya shrimp which had four little shrimp and the rest was rice.   And it was too salty. Seafood paella looked good but again there was a long line.  Overall, I was very disappointed.  There was nothing special about this festival.  I can have live lobsters or crab at home anytime for much less price.  
.

response: The Santa Barbara Harbor & Seafood Festival, located at 141-153 Harbor Way in Santa Barbara, CA, is a vibrant event offering a mix of seafood delicacies and arts and crafts. The festival spans a full day on Saturdays, from 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM, and draws a diverse crowd. The site includes several tents selling merchandise and various food vendors, with a focus on fresh seafood like sea urchin and spiky lobsters. Visitors can purchase live seafood and have it cooked at an additional fee, although long wait times for cooking services have been reported. The event also features a casual dining area and a takeout section, serving dishes such as ceviche, tuna melts, and tacos, which have generally received positive feedback. The atmosphere is described as fun and festive, with picnic tables under palm trees providing a scenic setting. However, some attendees have criticized the festival for being overcrowded and offering overpriced food. Despite mixed reviews, the event has an overall rating of 4.5 stars, reflecting its popularity and the enjoyment it brings to many visitors.

review_info.review_text: My favorite sandwich spot in Goleta, hands down!! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Only criticism would be that the wait time for a sandwich can be long sometimes, but it's because it's usually busy.
Love this place!!! The food is so good and amazing service every time. I highly recommend the chipotle Turkey club.

This is my second time trying this place and my first time at this location. The one in Paseo Nuevo is super disappointing and I thought this location might be better. It's not much. It is definitely cleaner and has a nicer atmosphere with nicer workers but the food is just not good. It smells and looks good but then you bite into it and it's like eating air with sauce. They rely on the sauce for flavor so they drench it. The chicken is always dry, overcooked, and flavorless, and the bread is stale and flavorless. They give good portions but it really isn't worth the money. It also does take quite a while to get you food no matter if it's busy or not, but I'm pretty understanding of that since I've worked in a restaurant before but for the wait, you would expect it to taste good.

response: Pickles & Swiss, located at 7060 Hollister Ave, Ste 102 in Goleta, CA, is a popular deli and sandwich shop known for its diverse menu and casual, trendy ambiance. Customers appreciate the restaurant's outdoor seating and free WiFi, making it a comfortable spot for group gatherings. It is open daily from 11:00 AM to 6:00 PM and offers takeout services. The establishment provides parking in a lot adjacent to the premises. According to customer reviews, the restaurant is highly rated for its food quality and service, with patrons particularly enjoying the chipotle turkey club. However, some customers have noted that the food can sometimes be overcooked and dry, and the wait times can be lengthy due to the restaurant's popularity. Despite these occasional drawbacks, Pickles & Swiss maintains a strong reputation as a favorite local eatery in Goleta.

review_info.review_text: My husband and I came in earlier today for lunch after I ordered my sandwich my husband ordered a club and didn't think anything about it while the girl made it because he assumed she knew what went on a club.  Once we got in the car I looked at the receipt and realized she made him a turkey sandwich so we went back in to ask her to add the other meat and to refund us and recharge the correct price since a club is a little more. She was very rude about it and told us she wasn't going to do anything about and proceeded to call us liars and say he asked for a turkey sub. I told her she didn't have to be so rude so she told me to "get the f**k out b***h" and if I had a problem with it I could "call her f***ing manager". Also she proceeded to cuss us as we walked out of the store. It was quite unacceptable and inappropriate of an employee to be this unprofessional and aggressive.

Small store, personnel not very well organized, store is only moderately clean. 
Staff is friendly sometimes, other times they will only barely recognize you.
Nice and clean location. Toppings look fresh and well stocked. Joaquin and Odalis are always helpful and friendly.

response: Subway is a fast-food restaurant located at 1940 Cliff Dr, Ste B-13 in Santa Barbara, California. Offering a variety of sandwiches, salads, and other menu items, the establishment operates from 9:00 AM to 10:30 PM daily, except on Sundays when it opens later at 11:00 AM. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating and takeout services, though the restaurant does not offer reservations or WiFi. It also provides a parking lot for customers. The restaurant has received mixed reviews, with notable customer experiences ranging from issues with staff behavior and organization to praise for cleanliness and helpful staff. One customer complained about a staff member's unprofessional and aggressive behavior when seeking a correction to their order, while another appreciated the clean store and friendly staff. Despite some negative experiences, the restaurant maintains a moderate rating based on its overall customer satisfaction.

source_info.name: Recipes Bakery & Gifts: An Australian Coffee House
source_info.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Bakeries, Food, Australian

review_info.review_text: Terrific!! Try the cinnamon roll French toast, STUPID GOOD! We ordered the quiche Lorraine and they were out of the ingredients so they made us a broccoli & cheddar quiche instead, WHOA!! AMAZING!! Don't miss this place when visiting Santa Barbara, we will be back!! WHAT A GEM!!

Oh man oh man. There's like 4 breakfast sandwiches that I've had over the years on my travels and I still think about them to this very day. Add Recipes to the list! The jalapeño cheddar biscuit breakfast sandwich is just ...*chef's kiss*. Located in a quaint Victorian home, this bakery offers the most tasty home baked goods. I also tried a cinnamon roll that deserves its props. I wish I could have bought one of everything. The owner was working hard all alone; you can tell he is a master at his craft. Already looking forward to my next trip back to SB.

This place is so cute! The bacon cheddar scone with homemade preserve, butter and homemade whipped cream is to die for!!! And it's gluten free. The icing on the cinnamon roll was superb and I'm usually not a cinnamon roll fan. And the fresh squeezed organs juice was very likely the best I have ever had!

response: Recipes Bakery & Gifts: An Australian Coffee House is a charming establishment located at 604 Santa Barbara St in Santa Barbara, CA. Known for its delightful Australian cuisine and baked goods, the bakery offers a range of breakfast options including French toast, quiche, and breakfast sandwiches. Customers praise the cinnamon roll French toast and jalapeño cheddar biscuit breakfast sandwich, which are described as "stupid good" and "chef's kiss" quality, respectively. The bakery also offers gluten-free options like the bacon cheddar scone, which is served with homemade preserves and whipped cream. The ambiance of the quaint Victorian home setting adds to the overall experience, making it a hidden gem in Santa Barbara. Reviews highlight the exceptional quality of the food and the dedication of the owner. The bakery is open daily from 7:30 AM to 1:00 PM, and patrons can enjoy outdoor seating or takeout.

review_info.review_text: Took a stop in Isla Vista and was craving bagels. The wait was maybe 7-10 minutes before ordering but so worth it. This place had such a wide selection of bagel sandwiches that it was hard to settle with the Earth, Wind, and Fire Bagel Sandwich. It was AMAZING! One was enough to share for two people. I was able to choose which bagel I wanted and ended with the Galaxy bagel! The siracha added a nice touch. Would love to return here.
Forgot to put bacon on bagel. I'm now very sad. Use this as a cautionary tale and do a bacon check before you leave! #Check4Bacon

The owner really needs to hire new people or train his employees enough to know that they're at work and not in class. 12/14/2021 I order two bagels & two hot chocolates for pickup. We get there about 3 minutes before estimated pick up, as we walk in there is a blonde white girl with a bag on her shoulder who glanced at us and went right back on her phone. We ask if our order is ready which we didnt expect it to be but still asked, and she grabs my two bagels each wrapped in one wrapper and placed on a random counter and my two hot chocolates the same. I nicely ask if they can rewarm them since they were left out for God knows how long, with the purse on her shoulder still she continues to work and make sandwhiches. After warming up the hot chocolates she slams it on the counter, i say thank you and she rolls her eyes and walks away. I'm outside drinking some of the hot chocolate in the nice rainy weather enjoying my time and I hear some elementary school style gossip going on inside of the business. The employees are hurdled up as the girl is telling them "oh they couldve warmed it up themselves " and continued not only gossiping about a customer right infront of them but also trying to state that we as customers should be doing her job?? I then nicely go in and let her know to next time wait for the customers to leave and then talk about them and right away she starts going off telling me i dont give a **** i dont care you can warm your own **** up and ended it up with a nice F U. As a business owner myself this is just embarrasing for the owner and knowing owners check their yelp reviews i know you'll see this. Extremely unproffesional and rude behavior and the county needs to go check on this business, employees watching tiktoks while customers are inside, slamming drinks and gossiping, working while having a purse on your shoulder. That absolutely flabbergasted me like seriously hire workers not jokes and clowns. Great bagels though !!

response: Bagel Cafe is a local restaurant and cafe located at 6551 Trigo Rd in Goleta, CA, offering a variety of bagels and sandwiches. Operating daily from 6:30 AM to 2:00 PM, the cafe provides ample outdoor seating and a drive-thru option, though it does not offer reservations or Wi-Fi. Customers can enjoy a diverse selection of bagels, as evidenced by a positive review highlighting the delicious Earth, Wind, and Fire Bagel Sandwich, which was large enough to share. Another customer, however, experienced a less satisfactory visit due to a forgotten bacon addition to their order, while a more severe incident involved poor customer service and unprofessional behavior from the staff, leading to a one-star rating. Despite these issues, the cafe maintains a solid 4-star rating based on customer reviews.

source_info.name: Palihouse Santa Barbara
source_info.categories: Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Cafes, Restaurants, Hotels

review_info.review_text:
WARNING to potencial visitors!
I do not like to write my  bad experiance, but this was over the top unprofesional service  I have had lately.
It was not first visit to this hotel, so I been extreamly dissapointed how NOONE ( staff) care about guests.
Jan 1 we arrived after we booked room with extra bed, because they advice us to do that while making reservation.We got air bad which was broken, 3 times over the night we asked for that solution, plus for pillow, sheets, blanket... did not work out because staff -guy has problem to understand any english words ( finally with sign language we explain him the different problemos)... long storry to final...- bed collapsed, noone responded, we lost any sleep at all, and finale come when we check out- after we told over and over what happend, lady ( without mask) did not charge us extra bed... Hallelujah - thanks for treat!!
The magic dissapeared... Also when we entered to reno room where you can not have any privace in the bathroom without door, with plastic outdoor shades inside (not protect lights from courtyard all nights) two towels for 3 people etc etc..list is not short...

Yes, it is still great location, cute hidden place with funky ideas, but the BASIC didn't work...
I'll try to understand their business policy without contacting any kind of inspection....

ANTI-FORMULAIC well-designed hotel, it was originally an Art-School founded in 1920 and is now a small boutique hotel with only 24 rooms but oozing with charm. The attention to detail is amazing from the welcoming tiles in the parking garage to the pleasant smell of flowers when you get on the elevator.

It has a perfect low-key appeal and design that feels "Santa Barbara" without the artificiality of primarily using white stucco and orange tiled roofs to fit local vibe like some fancy hotels in the area. Very cool place to stay and we loved it. The rooms are eclectic but memorable and we enjoyed resting in some of the public areas like the fireplace and fountain. 

The rooms have a GIANT bathtub for you to soak in and my wife was all chill and calm until she saw the shampoos, soap, and lotion were from "Diptique" and she went crazy texting her friends while I wondered why it felt slimy and made my eyes burn.

Location is tops, its easily walkable to some of the heavy-hitting sites and eateries in the Presido area, the longest we had to drive to anywhere else was 10 minutes.

Everyone that works here is extremely helpful and  friendly. Super clean and beautiful. But the best thing of all is that they really make your stay special. We are currently staying here for my girlfriends birthday and they wrote her a birthday note with chocolates and rose petals on the floor and bed such an amazing place with even better staff

response: Palihouse Santa Barbara, located at 915 Garden St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a boutique hotel that blends historic charm with modern amenities. Originally an Art School founded in 1920, it now offers a unique, small-scale hospitality experience with only 24 rooms. Customer reviews highlight the hotel's attention to detail, from the welcoming tiles in the parking garage to the pleasant floral scents in the elevators. The hotel's design captures a genuine "Santa Barbara" feel, making it stand out from other establishments in the area. However, one reviewer's experience was notably negative, describing unprofessional staff and basic room amenities that did not function properly, leading to a disrupted stay. Despite these issues, the hotel's location is praised for its proximity to popular sites and eateries in the Presido area. Additionally, guests appreciate the hotel's personalized touches, such as birthday notes and room decorations, which enhance their overall experience. The hotel offers free WiFi and outdoor seating, and its hours of operation are generally from 8 AM to 10 PM, with extended hours on Wednesdays through Sundays.

source_info.name: Teru Japanese Cuisine
source_info.categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Sushi Bars

review_info.review_text: Fresh seafood with selections from Japan. Great ambiance. The owners are lovely and the service was great. Excellent experience. Best sushi in Santa Barbara.
No ka oi. After living in Hawaii for 19 years and embracing the Japanese culture and food...Best in Santa Barbara.

This place is great. Chef owned and operated with a Japanese family run staff. The fish is extremely consistent and is of a slightly higher grade than anyplace else in town. The cold Sake list is affordable but good and the special board is local and or seasonal changing weekly or so. Best sushi in town. Ambiance is nice but its geared towards foodies and all the $ seems to be on the plates.

response: Teru Japanese Cuisine, located at 1305 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a highly-rated establishment that specializes in Japanese cuisine, including sushi and a selection of fresh seafood imported directly from Japan. The restaurant is open primarily in the evenings, with hours that vary from Tuesday to Saturday. Customers can benefit from the availability of validated parking in a garage, as well as the option for takeout orders. The restaurant accepts reservations, offering a classy dining experience that is geared towards food enthusiasts. Reviews highlight the excellent ambiance and the consistent quality of the fish, which is noted to be of a higher grade than other establishments in town. The service is praised for being attentive and the owners are commended for their warmth. Customers particularly appreciate the extensive and affordable cold sake list, as well as the rotating special board featuring local and seasonal offerings. The overall rating based on customer reviews is 4.5 stars, with multiple reviewers stating it offers the best sushi in Santa Barbara.

source_info.name: Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant
source_info.categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea

review_info.review_text: I am super disappointed. I love the Jeannine's in Montecito. But this one is just not that great. Coffee is not great , I think the drink coffee is a good indicator on how serious a place takes their coffee and this place does not do great coffee. I ordered chilequiles and we super excited since I love that dish most places I go to but tbh it was the worst chilequiles I've ever had. The taste was bitter and even my dad who eats everything and is not picky didn't eat it. Also I asked specifically not to overlook my eggs, and they were overcooked. Bummer! Paid 7 for fresh OJ... also not tasty. Ordered French toast for my boy and it was definitely the best thing we ordered. I also got a croissant and I know this is brutal but Costco makes them better. Sorry guys I hate to be so negative but to spend 65 bucks on breakfast that was a MAJOR let down. I will not be going back.

Visiting from SF - this place is excellent. Don't be out off by it's location in a mall. 

The food and service are top notch and the decor inside is super cute. 

We had the French toast and Avo toast with matcha lattes made with oat milk. 

Everything was made perfectly and was really delicious. The eggs had deep Orange yolks and were also super tasty. 

Two thumbs up!

I absolutely love the ambiance, and the attentive service.
The french toast was delicious!
Fresh OJ gets a two thumbs up!
Now the bacon! I'd go there just for that! 
Smokey and crisp!
My friend had that All American and she was pleased!
Definitely on repeat! 
Thanks to everyone for a nice experience!

response:
Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant, located at 7060 Hollister Ave, Ste 105 in Goleta, CA, is a local establishment offering a variety of American traditional food, breakfast and brunch, and coffee and tea. Known for its cozy and upscale ambience, the restaurant provides an inviting setting for diners. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating, complimentary WiFi, and the convenience of takeaway options. The bakery and restaurant operate on specific hours from Wednesday to Sunday, providing a welcoming spot for those seeking a casual yet refined dining experience.

Reviews suggest a mixed but generally positive reception. One customer, disappointed with the coffee quality and a few dish selections, found the experience to be underwhelming and pricey for the quality. In contrast, other patrons praised the restaurant's excellent service and delicious offerings like French toast, avocado toast, and fresh orange juice. The standout items, according to positive reviews, include the smoky bacon and perfectly cooked eggs, which received high praise for their taste and presentation. Despite the varying opinions, Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant maintains a 4.5-star rating, indicating a favorable overall impression among its customers.

review_info.review_text:
Meh.

Granted, as a vegetarian I may not be the intended diner of OTS. That being said, I've been a couple times with different omnivorous friends who have ranging impressions of the place. While some of my friends seem to like it, many seemed underwhelmed by the wings, their staple item. I've gotten the artichoke hearts a couple times, which are decent, but offensively overpriced. This seems to be the moral of On the Side's story.

Possibly the place's saving grace is their great selection of brews. Unfortunately, their selection comes with a price. They have a bunch of flat screens, so I'd say this is a good place to grab a drink and watch a game, but I wouldn't recommend it much further than that.

They changed the way you order which is TOTAL CRAP!!! Instead of resteraunt style ordering everyone has to order up at the counter now which is just ridiculous. They need to change this back again ASAP!

Good food. The portions looked kinda small at first, but was full by the time I finished everything. My favorite item is the buffalo wings, they might be some of the best in santa barbara. The service was like whatevers, the waitress was kind of a noob and forgot about taking back the bill so i had to go up to the counter and pay there.

response: On the Side, located at 6521 Pardall Rd in Isla Vista, CA, is a traditional American restaurant that offers a variety of food options and a notable selection of beers. The restaurant provides outdoor seating and takeout services, making it a convenient spot for groups and casual dining. However, it does not accept reservations, which might be a drawback for those seeking a guaranteed table. According to customer reviews, the restaurant's buffalo wings are a standout favorite for some, particularly praised for their quality. On the other hand, the restaurant's shift to counter-ordering has been met with mixed reactions, with some customers finding it inconvenient. Vegetarian options are limited and somewhat pricey, as noted by a reviewer. Despite these criticisms, the restaurant's ambiance seems to cater well to watching sports, as it features multiple flat-screen TVs. Overall, On the Side garners a moderate rating of 3.5 stars, suggesting that while it has its strengths, there is room for improvement in several areas.

source_info.name: Paradise Cafe
source_info.categories: American (Traditional), American (New), Nightlife, Restaurants, Seafood, Cafes

review_info.review_text: Used to be one of my favorite places to frequent. Not anymore and they took my favorite item off the menu. Menu sucks now. But new owners don't care. That's why they will go out of business soon. Sorry but that's their choice. I'd give them a fat zero if I could. They suck.

This used to be our favorite restaurant in Santa Barbara. We went there in February 2020 after it was purchased by new owners. In short, it should no longer be called the Paradise Cafe as it bears no resemblance to the original restaurant. The food was mediocre. We ordered a salad which came undressed, looked like it had been prepared by a child, and had no flavor and a tiny piece of salmon. It as listed as an entree but was more like an appetizer portion. Burgers, which used to be fabulous, now taste terrible, with poor quality meat and fries so bad my kids would not eat them. A fried chicken appetizer was unedible.  This used to be a fantastic restaurant, with genuinely good food and wonderful service, in a laid back atmosphere. They've kept the name and nothing else. The food now tastes like something you could get at a college cafeteria or out of a Cisco-supplied chain restaurant. What a loss for Santa Barbara.

I loved the calamari appetizer! Super tasty and fun with a dip. Also the fried chicken was exceptional. The bar service was quick and Michelle took great care of us! Bloody Mary was on point. Definitely recommend!

response:
Paradise Cafe, located at 702 Anacapa St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a versatile establishment offering American (Traditional and New), Seafood, and a range of cafe items. Operating from 11:00 AM, the cafe adjusts its closing hours based on the day of the week, staying open until 10:00 PM on weekdays and extending to 11:00 PM on Friday and Saturday. The cafe provides free WiFi and supports reservations, with outdoor seating available. Customers can also enjoy the takeout service. The ambiance is described as casual, and the cafe is well-suited for group visits.

However, recent reviews suggest a decline in customer satisfaction following a change in ownership. A significant portion of the feedback criticizes the new menu, particularly the quality and portion sizes of the food items. One reviewer fondly recalls the previous menu and service, lamenting the current state of the establishment. Conversely, another positive review highlights the calamari appetizer and fried chicken as exceptional, praising the bar service and the quality of the Bloody Mary. Despite these mixed reviews, Paradise Cafe maintains a 3.5-star rating.

review_info.review_text: Had the Ai Roll Ai Roll, not very good... I mean it's edible and tastes okay.. but I don't think it justifies the price.

Chicken bowl was disappointing. When I asked for white meat only they informed me that they only carry dark meat.... 

I consider myself to be pretty easy to please,considering my college budget, however I'm pretty sure I will never eat there again...unless forced.


I will not be returning, no matter what they change the name too.

So I came with a group of co-workers after tring to figure out a place to eat. I was craving something somewhat healthy so I went with the Teriyaki chicken bowl. I asked for brown rice but they only serve white. the chicken tasted rubbery and they loaded they soaked the bowl with sauce. Even though it was only $6 bucks I wouldn't have spent a $1 on this! The service was extra slow and the staff wasn't friendly. I will not be back.

response:
Mika is a Japanese restaurant located at 7020 Market Place Dr in Goleta, CA. The establishment offers takeout services and has outdoor seating available, but it does not accept reservations. Customers can park at the lot nearby, as it is the only parking option provided.

Based on customer reviews, Mika has received a relatively low rating of 2.5 stars. One diner found the Ai Roll Ai Roll to be edible but not worth the price, while another was disappointed with the chicken bowl, particularly noting the lack of white meat options and the overall unfavorable experience. Another customer reported that the chicken teriyaki was rubbery, the meal was overly saucy, and the service was slow and unfriendly. These reviews suggest that the food quality and customer service at Mika may fall short of expectations, leading to a generally unsatisfactory dining experience.

source_info.name: Holdren's Grill
source_info.categories: Seafood, American (New), Restaurants, Nightlife, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

review_info.review_text: I have to give this restaurant a 1-star rating purely due to horrible service. While the extremely pricey menu options were surprisingly good, the service in the whole restaurant was awful! Our server came to our table twice the entire night. Once to seat us, and once after we waited a very long time to get our check. He never came to check on us or ask how our food was even once! One table next to us even walked out before getting their food, or maybe they just never received it. A couple sat at the hostess stand for a good 10 mins before anyone greeted them as well. I'm surprised they didn't leave! It's too bad that the staff was so un attentive, because the food was actually pretty good! We will probably not be returning here:/

I frequent this location often on the weekends as a hang-out location with my friends. Over the many time I have been here, I have had a consistent experience with the food, the environment, as well as the service. 

When you open the menu, you will be quite surprised at the wide variety of choices available. Dishes range from crab-cakes to artichoke dips to filet mignons. Personally, I have tried the steaks many times at Holdrens, as well as a few of their select appetizers. The food is good for the price, typically around $20-$30 per individual (Combination of entree and appetizer). To me, having frequented many steakhouses in the United States such as Mastro's and Strip House, I would have to say that the quality and presentation of the slab of meat is on par with my expectations. It might be a little bit on the high side in terms of the food, but what can you expect, it is Santa Barbara. I expect the price to be more catered to the location when looking at the prices. Overall, I was happy with my food because it was delicious and I left the restaurant a happy customer. 

Many people on Yelp have been complaining about the poor service and lack of attention they received during their experience. During my few times at Holdren's, I have yet to encounter any problems. The service is excellent and attentive, and my table was always served and cared for properly. 

Overall, my experience at Holdren's was pleasant. I understand that it is located near Santa Barbara, which is prime real-estate. I expect many restaurants to institute a premium in their prices because of this. As a happy customer, I will continue to frequent this location with my friends when I do have the chance.

My family went there for my brother's birthday. The wait staff was polite and courteous but the food was terrible. The steaks were burnt and the fish was undercooked. My mom and I split the bill and they ended up charging me for the entire bill!  I spoke with the manager a few days later and she said she would refund the portion I didn't owe, and instead CHARGED me again. Thank god I had enough money in my account to cover the charges. My bill was $86 and instead I got charged twice for a total of $411.08. Ridiculous, they lost me and my family's business forever.

response:
Holdren's Grill, located at 6920 Market Pl Dr in Goleta, CA, is a versatile dining establishment offering a blend of seafood and American cuisine in both traditional and new styles. The restaurant is open from 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM on weekdays and extends its hours to 10:00 PM on weekends. It offers outdoor seating, free WiFi, and takeout options. Customers can make reservations in advance. The parking is available on-site, but it is not validated, and there is no valet service.

Customer reviews reveal mixed experiences. While some patrons praise the restaurant for its attentive service, varied menu options, and high-quality food, others criticize the poor service and overcharging. The restaurant's ambiance is described as intimate, but the overall rating of 2.5 stars indicates that the service issues are a significant concern for many diners. The food quality is generally well-regarded, but service inconsistencies and unexpected financial discrepancies have led to dissatisfaction among some customers.

source_info.name: Fresco Cafe
source_info.categories: American (Traditional), Bakeries, Restaurants, Italian, Breakfast & Brunch, Food

review_info.review_text: The Walnut Gorgonzola salad never disappoints. Ordered with a scoop of chicken salad, it is the perfect meal. The mixed greens are fresh with the proper ratio of walnuts and Gorgonzola. The chicken salad is tasty and tender, but seems to be lacking in something for added flavor, a little lemon or dill perhaps for some added zest. Ordering is easy, and there is ample dining outdoors. Fresco Cafe is definitely on my go to list for a delicious meal.

I've eaten at Fresco on and off for the past 15 years. I stopped by on 12/30 at 4:30 pm to pick up a quick order of fries, soup and desserts. After paying, I walked by the open kitchen to wait for my order and noticed that one of the cooks was NOT WEARING A MASK and was USING HIS HANDS TO EAT WHILE ALSO PREPPING FOOD IN THE KITCHEN. I was shocked, especially based upon the skyrocketing COVID cases in the past few days. I spoke with the manager and asked for a refund. He was very nice but explained that this was his first shift and he did not know how to issue a refund. I asked for the contact information for the owner and he was unable to provide this (said they were out of business cards). He promised me that if I left my number someone would contact me.

Really great locals joint... used to live/work nearby and would eat here almost every day. Huge selection of different types of food, good cupcakes & chocolate cake, Arnold Palmer unlimited refills, friendly & efficient staff! Delicious salads the Gorgonzola walnut is classic. Their Saturday special Jack Daniels ribs & fries with Dijon are phenomenal. Best ribs in town with Carlitos. A terrific spot where you'll always know what to expect. The wraps are delicious as well. Pretty sure they have largest, most diverse salad selection in town. Their Ahi club is all worldly see photo. French club sandwiches are so half assed. Frescos is quality & savoir faire in club sandwich department.

response: Fresco Cafe, located at 3987 State St, Ste B in Santa Barbara, California, is a versatile dining establishment offering a variety of American, Italian, and breakfast & brunch options. Known for its diverse menu and friendly service, Fresco Cafe receives a 4.0-star rating and is open from 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating, and the restaurant provides takeout services, making it convenient for those on the go. The cafe is praised for its Walnut Gorgonzola salad, which is a favorite among regulars, and its large selection of salads and sandwiches. One customer specifically mentions the Jack Daniels ribs and fries on Saturdays as a must-try. However, there have been concerns regarding health and safety protocols, notably an incident where a cook was observed not wearing a mask during food preparation, leading to a negative review. Despite this, the cafe continues to attract a loyal following and is recognized for its consistent quality and inviting atmosphere.

source_info.name: Killer B's BBQ Bar and Grill
source_info.categories: Sports Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Food, Barbeque, American (Traditional)

review_info.review_text:
This place gets 5 stars on all fronts. The server we had was genuine and friendly. We sat on the patio with our dog and despite it being chilly she made sure to check on is often. All of the food was exceptional. I ordered the brisket which is amazing. It falls apart in your mouth and has a fantastic flavor thanks to the 15 hours of slow cooking. My boyfriend got a half rack of ribs which were equally tender and delicious. The owner came out and spoke to us several times and even treated our dog to some of the fabulous brisket. 

If you are looking for exceptional BBQ at a place with a down-to-earth staff this is it. We live in Ventura buy we will definitely be back.

Love this place! Always loved the food as they truly due have Killer BBQ. From pulled pork sandwiches to tri-tip the food is always a win. Now with the new location with the huge dog friendly patio, I think I just found my new favorite spot to watch a game, have a beer or a great meal. Looking forward to going there again and again!

Killer B's IS OPEN - 731 De La Guerra Plaza!  It quietly reopened earlier in December and is well worth searching out at its new location inside De La Guerra Plaza across from City Hall.  Entrance is through the brightly-lit, large patio with plenty of tables (each complete with a full paper towel dispenser - they don't mess around) and heaters for cooler evenings.  For the sports fans there are flatscreen TVs on the exterior walls with volume off or very low for the dinner-conversation fans.  The inside dining area looked warm and inviting.  My two friends and I sat outside and witnessed the BBQ items being removed from the gigantic smoker in the corner of the patio; proof positive this is REAL, slow-cooked BBQ, not baked, as previously mentioned by a person with a wooden "pallet."  We were told the menu selection will expand once they get their rhythm and flow going with the new kitchen, a wise strategy to keep quality of food and service high.  The juicy pulled-pork sandwich was loaded and stacked tall, and got a big thumbs up.  The baby back ribs were meaty, tender, and moist, with knock-out flavor.  Those last remaining, tasty crisp bits clinging to the bone make one want to pick off every last morsel, so give yourself time to really work those ribs.  The rub and smoke flavors are well balanced with just the right amount of sweetness, tang, and rich carmelized goodness in the sauce.  My buddy, who is very particular about his beans, said the baked beans were delicious.  My side of green beans and corn was cooked just enough to leave a little crunch with nice roasted flavor.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  Two of us were allowed to split a full rack of ribs and our 1-free-entree Axxess card deal was honored with a smile - gotta love that!  The owner, Will, visited with us for a while and told us of his plans for the new location and future events, all of which sound great. My dinner mates and I are slow-cook BBQ fans and are so happy to have a place in Santa Barbara that does it right.  Next time there is live music in De La Guerra plaza, I will find a table there and enjoy what the full bar has to offer.  We hope Killer B's kills it in the new location so we can continue to enjoy local BBQ that is the real deal.

response: Killer B's BBQ Bar and Grill, located at 718 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a popular sports bar and restaurant known for its exceptional barbeque and friendly atmosphere. The establishment is open daily from 9:00 AM to midnight, with extended hours on weekdays. It offers a range of traditional American and barbeque dishes, including well-reviewed items such as brisket, ribs, and pulled pork sandwiches. Customers praise the quality of the food, with particular mention of the tender, flavorful brisket and ribs that are slow-cooked for up to 15 hours. The restaurant features outdoor seating, making it a favorite spot for patrons with dogs, as noted by the attentive service to both customers and their pets. Killer B's also boasts a full bar, flatscreen TVs for sports enthusiasts, and free Wi-Fi, creating a welcoming environment for groups and casual diners alike. The business maintains a four-star rating based on numerous five-star reviews, highlighting its commitment to quality and customer satisfaction.

review_info.review_text:
RIP European Deli. I really enjoyed you. 
Going through old receipts, it looks like the owner's name may have been Evelyn. Vielen Dank :)

I agree with the review below me and although this restaurant may be long gone, I still need to leave 5 stars review for European deli!

This was a family owned business. The older lady that was in charge was so nice and she was very patient with me as I slowly browsed through all their menu and each and every single type of sausage they had. My boyfriend opted for the bratwurst combo meal and I always got their sandwich. I forgot what kind of sandwich I got but I remember it being super good. They served their homemade potato salad and sauerkraut. I'm not a big fan of their sauerkraut but my boyfriend loved it! We both equally enjoyed their potato salad because it tasted like authentic european potato salad with big potato chunks!

I really wish European deli would open up again. :( I was so broken hearted when I found out they closed.. still reminiscing even though I'm 100 miles away! Hope the family that ran the restaurant is doing well!

I don't think I have ever been more disappointed to hear of a restaurant closing. It deserves a final review as having the very best German potato salad and roast beef I have ever had. I am still trying to find someplace in LA/OC even close. Let me know if anyone has a favorite place.

response:
European Deli, formerly located at 149 N Fairview Ave in Goleta, CA, was a beloved family-owned establishment known for its authentic European cuisine. The deli offered a variety of menu items, including sausages, sandwiches, and homemade sides such as potato salad and sauerkraut, which garnered significant praise from patrons. Customers particularly highlighted the quality of the German potato salad and roast beef, noting that the deli's offerings were some of the best they had ever tasted. The business was praised for its friendly service and accommodating atmosphere, with staff members like the older lady in charge being remembered fondly for their patience and warmth.

The deli provided a welcoming environment for both individual diners and groups, and it featured outdoor seating, adding to its charm. Although it has since closed, the establishment remains fondly remembered by its patrons, who have left multiple 5-star reviews expressing their nostalgia and regret over its closure. The deli also offered takeout services, making it convenient for customers to enjoy its authentic European flavors.

review_info.review_text:
I was so hungry and craving Japanese food so I was super excited there was a Sakura right next to Swarovski where I work!

But the portion was super teeny and it didn't make me full at all :( I got a beef teriyaki bowl, which was delicious, but it was $10 and I'm still hungry right now.

The employees are nice and the food is good though!

I really need to stop assuming restaurants have online menus and take more pictures of menus. Sigh. Anyway, my mum and I came here for lunch when we were checking out the Paseo Nuevo Shopping Center in SB. As usual, this is a Japanese restaurant owned by Koreans. The lady behind the counter was really friendly but the male employee (co-owner?) was definitely less so. We ordered at the counter and were given a number for our order. The food is a bit pricey, but my mum wanted Asian food so this is where we ended up. Since it was a nice day, we took a seat at a table on the patio and waited for our food and water to be brought to us.

When the lady took our order, she had asked if we wanted anything to drink. I told her two waters, please, and she acknowledged my request. And yet the water never came... not cool.

After a while, the male employee brought us our food. My mum had gotten the Beef Curry Bowl and I got the Dragon Roll. He also brough us utensils and one napkin each. He dropped my napkin on the floor, so he picked it up and walked away. I thought he was going to bring me another napkin, but he didn't. We chalked it up to him being weird and also very unfriendly. Is he the same unfriendly owner that the other Yelpers have been ranting about? While he wasn't outright rude to us, I can totally picture him being rude to customers.

As for the food... my roll was okay. It wasn't great, it wasn't bad, it was just fine. But my mum did not like her beef curry bowl at all. She thought the meat was mediocre and the curry was bland. She was not a fan of the food at all. While I don't think this place merits just one star, at least not in my experience, they definitely can't get higher than two stars, since they really were just meh.

Not worth one dollar I paid! Half my food was cold, small portion for the $$ and dirty place. Our table was cleaned with a rag that smelled badly, food took A LONG TIME to arrive at our table. Avoid this place if possible!

response: Sakura Express is a Japanese restaurant located at 819 State St in Santa Barbara, California. The establishment does not offer reservations or parking facilities, but it does provide outdoor seating and takeout options. Customers have noted mixed reviews regarding the restaurant's ambiance, with some describing it as touristy but not particularly romantic or upscale. According to customer feedback, the food quality is variable; one reviewer enjoyed the beef teriyaki bowl, finding it delicious despite the small portion size, while another found the beef curry bowl to be mediocre and bland. Service has been criticized for its inconsistency, with some praising the friendliness of the staff and others mentioning unfriendly interactions, particularly with male employees. Additionally, customers have reported issues with slow service and cleanliness. Overall, Sakura Express has received a two-star rating based on customer reviews, indicating that while the food can be good, there are significant areas for improvement in terms of service and portion sizes.

review_info.review_text: wait..this is the greek italian deli... and there closed... that sucks... i cant even explain how good the food was... the hot pastrami was unmatched!!! it was a family run spot since the beginning...and everyone was friendly as fuck!!!

Sadly, the Italian and Greek deli has closed its doors forever as of April 14, 2007. I was there myself, picking up a meatball sub soon after they'd opened for business. If it's any testament to their popularity, I saw the lunch queue 30 people deep the Thursday before they closed, and the shop had about 50 people in it within 5 minutes of opening on their last Saturday.  My meatball sub was delicious.
This store was open for business for 36 years, my mother recalls this was the only place she could buy phyllo pastry way back when. For me, I liked the shop because it was the first in Santa Barbara to carry halloumi cheese. 
Quelle bummer to lose the Italian and Greek deli! But life goes on.

The pastrami sandwich is well, the best I've ever had.  It's all warmly scrumptious and peppery and toasty and goo-ily provoloney and has pickles and pepperoncinis and is totally EPIC in its proportions (must be the Greek side of things). Mmmm....Even Carnegie Deli doesn't do it as well as these guys-different part of the country, but still... 

Killer Greek Salad (dolmas anyone?), various marinated olive selection in their case, and major bonus points for deviled egg option as well. The meatball sando hits the spot. But it's the GYRO that makes my tastebuds gyrate (I've never tried the cluck, but the lamb/beef dynamic option is fantastic). This is just about the best lunch in town, and you're home free with a big ol' Pellegrino and chips for less than 10 bucks. One of my favorite spots for sure. A fun stop on Farmer's Market Tuesday evenings!

response: The Italian & Greek Delicatessen, located at 636 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, was a beloved local restaurant and deli that operated for 36 years until its unfortunate closure in April 2007. This family-run establishment was praised for its exceptional food quality and friendly atmosphere. Customers particularly raved about the hot pastrami sandwiches, which were described as unmatched in taste and quality. Other favorites included the meatball subs, gyro, and a variety of Greek salads and deli items. The business was known for carrying unique products like halloumi cheese and phyllo pastry, making it a go-to spot for both locals and visitors. Despite the lack of specific business hours and attributes provided, the deli was renowned for its excellent customer service and affordable meals, making it one of the best lunch spots in town. The closure was met with disappointment, as evidenced by the reviews, reflecting the significant impact the deli had on the community.

review_info.review_text: A big WOW! I found El Taco Grande by accident, across the street from another taco shop that I've been to. I decided to try it and their food is excellent! So I wouldn't feel so stuffed, I went for their solo Chile Relleno and a crispy taco (not a combination plate). I also witnessed several others enjoying their food, noticeably carne asada burritos, a few other types of tacos, and Caldo 7 Mares (seven seas soup). YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS PLACE!

We popped in here because it was close by, and we are so glad we did. Taco Grande serves up delicious food, generous portions, great prices, excellent service, and one of the best salsas I have ever eaten. We will definitely be back.
Was there in March. Nobody wears masks or says hello and it was empty. Went to rudys across the street and it was great.

response: El Taco Grande is a Mexican restaurant located at 1096 Casitas Pass Rd in Carpinteria, California. The restaurant is known for its generous portions and excellent service, as mentioned by satisfied customers. It offers a variety of Mexican dishes, including Chile Relleno, crispy tacos, carne asada burritos, and a notable Caldo 7 Mares (seven seas soup), which has received high praise for its flavor. Customers have also highlighted the delicious salsa and reasonable prices. The restaurant provides outdoor seating and takeout options but does not offer indoor WiFi or reservations. Operating hours vary, with limited hours on Fridays compared to the rest of the week. Despite positive reviews, one customer had a negative experience due to the lack of mask-wearing staff and a cold reception. El Taco Grande is highly recommended for groups and casual outings.

source_info.name: The Red Piano
source_info.categories: Event Planning & Services, Nightlife, Bars, Music Venues, Musicians, Piano Bars, Lounges, Arts & Entertainment, Dance Clubs, Cocktail Bars

review_info.review_text: Really cute bar situated in downtown Santa Barbara. I did not sit inside where the pianos are at, but sat outside (outside seating/patio area is available right on the street post Covid). Really fun atmosphere, able to grab a drink and listen to live music, as well as people watch. Plenty of standing heaters available for when it's chilly outside. Only downfall was there is no food offered; so you can only stay so long.
Met my future wife here.  We had an amazing night listening to music in the awesome ambiance.  Very entertaining.
Cool atmosphere.  Fun piano bar vibe with sing alongs. Bartenders are sociable and attentive. The cocktails were not to my liking.  They were good but could have had a little more love in them.

response: The Red Piano, located at 519 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a multifaceted entertainment venue that combines the charm of a piano bar with the energy of a cocktail lounge. This establishment offers a wide range of services including live music, dancing, and a cozy atmosphere, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists. The business features outdoor seating, accessible parking, and free Wi-Fi, enhancing the overall experience for its patrons. Customers can enjoy live music performances and socialize in an upscale yet intimate setting. However, it's worth noting that the venue does not offer food services, which could limit the duration of visits. Reviews indicate that the atmosphere is fun and romantic, with many praising the live music and attentive staff. Despite occasional critiques about the cocktail quality, The Red Piano maintains a high rating, with an average of 4.5 stars based on customer reviews.

source_info.name: Nardonne's La Famiglia Pizzeria
source_info.categories: Pizza, Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Italian, Food, Sandwiches

review_info.review_text: I just ordered and helped eat "The Works".  It was spectacular.  Very tasty, generous on the toppings and acceptably priced.
This place is great, but why the hell aren't you answering your phone on a Saturday night for delivery??????? If I was the owner a lot of people would be getting fired!!!!

A friends & me were looking for a good pizza in Santa Barbara and we weren't disappointed. The pizzas are huge, pizza dough are very thick & well topped. 

If you like thick pizza dough and having a lot of cheese on your pizza, this is the right place

response: Nardonne's La Famiglia Pizzeria, located at 17 W Ortega St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a popular dining establishment offering a variety of Italian and pizza dishes, along with beverages such as beer and wine. The restaurant is known for its generous servings and high-quality food, as noted in customer reviews. One reviewer praised "The Works" pizza, describing it as spectacular, very tasty, and well-topped. Another customer appreciated the large, thick-crust pizzas with ample cheese. The restaurant provides free WiFi, offers takeout services, and accommodates reservations. It also features outdoor seating and is noted for being suitable for group dining. The business offers parking options on the street and in a nearby garage, and it has received a high rating of 4.5 stars based on customer reviews. While most reviews are positive, there is one mention of service issues with unanswered phone calls for delivery, suggesting that while the food is excellent, communication could be improved.

source_info.name: California Pasta
source_info.categories: Caterers, Italian, Food Delivery Services, American (New), Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food

review_info.review_text: New girl working was very nice tonight for our takeout order! Answered phone politely,  gave us appropriate amount of napkins, utensils and condiments. We felt like valued customers! Thanks

The minestrone was aweful. I got a bowl of onion and celery and maybe 3 pieces of pasta. I'm going to go try them again next week because I work close by but the minestrone was not good to me. I know it's usually a hit or miss but this was a complete miss and I had to go buy lunch again else where.

Very sad to write this review because I used to love this place. I ordered a Cajun pasta and it tasted sour like vinegar, as if they had poured a whole bottle of Tabasco. I double checked and asked to see if it was Cajun sauce and was reassured it was. I asked if I could get something else because it didn't taste like Cajun sauce. The lady went to ask the manager who said I could buy a new meal with a 10% discount off. Not sure who taught them how to fix a meal.... I had barely eaten it. I asked for a side of sauce because they wouldn't take it back. They brought me a side of Alfredo sauce and it tasted worse. It tasted putrid and awful. Will not be returning...

response:
California Pasta is a local eatery located at 811 State St, Ste B in Santa Barbara, California, offering a variety of Italian and American cuisine options. The restaurant operates daily from 11:00 AM to 9:00 PM, providing both in-house dining with outdoor seating and takeout services. Customers can enjoy a casual dining atmosphere without Wi-Fi, and the restaurant does not accept reservations or provide valet parking, although street parking is available.

Reviews from patrons reflect a mixed experience. One customer praised the friendly and attentive service they received for their takeout order, highlighting the staff's politeness and the inclusion of all necessary utensils and condiments. However, other reviews have been more critical. One customer complained about the poor quality of the minestrone soup, describing it as unsatisfactory and barely containing any pasta. Another reviewer expressed disappointment with the taste of a Cajun pasta dish, which they found sour and reminiscent of vinegar, leading them to request a replacement meal with a modest discount, which also did not meet their expectations. Despite these negative experiences, the restaurant maintains a moderate 3.5-star rating.

source_info.name: Crushcakes Cafe & Simply Pies
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Bakeries, Cafes, Coffee & Tea, Food, Desserts

review_info.review_text:
My first review of Crushcakes was for the vegan blueberry scone, which let me tell you is super duper. Now, I've been coming to this location almost weekly for several months to study, and I'm updating my review--but not my 5-star rating. With a cute back patio, a customer loyalty punch card, and lovely vegan baked goods (cinnamon and blueberry scones and a variety of cupcakes) as well as full meals and fresh, hot coffee (be sure to ask for it in a "for here" cup if you're staying!) I'm crushing on Crushcakes. 

This morning, employees Dana, Niku, and Katey were especially helpful. My small coffee with a splash of oat milk ($3) hit the spot in the chilly weather. As a vegan, I love the fact that Crushcakes doesn't upcharge for plant-based milks. My only critique is that the wifi is touch-and-go, especially on the back patio, and there aren't any exterior outlets. But with a fully-charged computer and digital text to read, the back is a great spot to get some work done or gather for a Covid-safer breakfast or lunch. Big picnic-style tables provide ample room for studying too. Thanks Crushcakes!

I have been buying cupcakes from Crushcakes for many years, mostly at the Santa Barbara location, and they have always been yummy...moist, flavorful, and my absolute favorite cupcakes ever. Today my husband brought home several of the "mini" cupcakes for me (from the Goleta location).  It had been a while since I had treated myself to a Crushcake, and I was so excited!  I had asked for the Red Velvet and Vanilla Bean flavors, but found when I opened the box that, although my husband had specifically ordered Red Velvet cupcakes, there were none to be found.  They were plain chocolate.  And they were *super* dry.  The Vanilla Bean cupcakes were also dry, and the frosting didn't even reach the level of the frosting you find in supermarket bakeries.  I am so sad and disappointed! Hoping I can still find the deliciousness I remember at the Santa Barbara location!

The staff at Crushcakes were so helpful, I wanted to try everything (and one can, if one has 8 stomachs). Their cupcake of the day, the scrumptious mocha, was a party on my palate. Perfectly moist and flavorful. This confectionary gem is a fantastic choice for cupcakes and pies to boot! Crushcakes is a must and that's the sweet and honest tooth.

response: Crushcakes Cafe & Simply Pies, located at 5392 Hollister Ave in Goleta, CA, is a versatile establishment offering a range of services including cafes, bakeries, and a place to enjoy desserts and coffee. Operating from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM daily, the cafe provides a customer loyalty program, outdoor seating, and free WiFi to enhance the experience of its patrons. The cafe is known for its vegan-friendly options and diverse menu that includes scones, cupcakes, and full meals, complemented by fresh, hot coffee. Customers appreciate the cozy atmosphere, especially the back patio, which is ideal for studying or working, though some reviewers note that the WiFi can be unreliable. The cafe offers takeout services and is praised for not charging extra for plant-based milk options. While one customer reported dry cupcakes and a mix-up with flavors, others have praised the cafe's moist and flavorful cupcakes, particularly the mocha cupcake of the day. Overall, Crushcakes Cafe & Simply Pies stands out as a welcoming spot for both casual dining and studying, with a strong emphasis on quality baked goods and customer service.

source_info.name: Daves Dogs - Cart
source_info.categories: Food Stands, Food, Hot Dogs, Street Vendors, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
I love me some Dave's dogs !! I want some rn ! I love Dave and his cooks and workers all so sweet and amAzing ! They on point and the food just is so ridiculously delicious! You will keep comming back for more ! I love them all try everything!! And keep trying them they all
So good and just different ' I didn't even like hot dogs till I went to Dave's dogs ' try combining dogs too my favorites are taco dog and Alfredo dog so dank !

This is by far one of the best hot dog places on the west coast I've been and my wife and have been everywhere---from Seattle to San Diego. The creativity of the different types of dogs, will tempt you to destroy your diet plan and visit this place multiple times until you've conquered every single one! Oh and I dare you, I double dog dare you (nice, right!), to try the fried pickles....

Absolutely amazing food! I've only been once but there's so many things on the menu I'm still dying to try. The atmosphere is so unique, social, and nostalgic. The perfect late night snack spot. So glad we found this gem!

response: Daves Dogs - Cart, located at 132 S Milpas St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a popular food stand and street vendor known for its hot dogs. Operating primarily on late evenings from Tuesday through Saturday, the business offers a variety of hot dog options, including creative combinations like the taco dog and Alfredo dog, which have garnered praise from customers. The business does not offer indoor seating but provides outdoor seating, and it is highly accessible for those arriving by street parking or lots nearby. Customers appreciate the friendly service and the delicious, unique flavors of the hot dogs, with many noting their intention to return to try more menu items. The business has received a perfect 5-star rating based on several reviews, which highlight the food quality, the welcoming atmosphere, and the innovative menu offerings.

source_info.name: Here's the Scoop
source_info.categories: Desserts, Gelato, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Cafes, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: I just checked my credit card after reading the many horrible comments about the owner adding his own tip and even though I gave him $0 on the receipt, he added his own $3 tip. This place is an absolute disgrace. DO NOT GO HERE.

Inedible ice cream. My ice cream tasted like water and was icy and melted. The owner looked miserable and was upset when he gave me the wrong ice cream and when I said I ordered pumpkin he rolled his eyes. He did not wear gloves and the ice cream cone did not have a paper wrapping. His fingers were bloody and he had dirt under his finger nails. I was grossed out when he handed me the ice cream and I had to throw the entire thing out. Disgusting. This store is completely unsanitary. DO NOT GO. He did not even wear a mask

Upon walking into Here's the Scoop with my mother and two daughter's we were excited to try a scoop of gelato in the quaint town of Montecito. We walked in and smiled and said hello to the owner an older man who did not respond or greet us upon arrival. He looked miserable and we didn't feel welcome at all. Even my toddler noticed that he wasn't friendly. There weren't any seats to sit outside so we opted to sit inside as I had my two younger children with me. The entire time we were sitting inside it was extremely awkward and quite. For it being an ice cream shop you would expect some cheerfulness. Not here. I also noticed he gave himself a three dollar tip which I did NOT authorize. I wouldn't have normally disputed a charge like this but it's the principle. He definitely has a reputation for this after reading all of his bad reviews. Please DO NOT support this small business.

response: Here's the Scoop is a dessert and ice cream shop located at 1187 Coast Village Rd in Montecito, California. The establishment offers a variety of treats, including gelato, ice cream, and frozen yogurt, and is categorized as a cafe and restaurant. It operates from 12:00 PM to 9:00 PM on weekdays, with extended hours until 10:00 PM on Fridays and Saturdays. Outdoor seating is not available, and while the shop does not offer validated parking, street parking is accessible. Customers can take out their orders, but the business does not provide reservations or indoor seating with a welcoming ambience. Despite its offerings, the shop has faced criticism, particularly regarding the owner's practices. Several reviews mention unsanitary conditions, the owner's poor attitude, and unauthorized tips being added to receipts. Due to these concerns, patrons are advised to exercise caution when considering a visit to Here's the Scoop.

source_info.name: Char West
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Fish & Chips, Food, Seafood, American (Traditional), Fast Food, Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch

review_info.review_text: It was the worst fish n chips I've ever had. I believe the fish was tilapia as it tasted muddy. We felt disgusted after eating there. The same type of fish was used in the fish taco. We were hungry and was super disappointed with the meal. If you want to eat muddy tasty fish, you can give it a try. It's worst than the frozen fish from the grocery store.

Nice stop on the pier for coffee

This is a no frills, no fuss, coffee shop (but also serves  food?!) right on the edge of the pier.  It looks like they are not getting extremely high marks for food, but if you go into the place it doesn't feel like a spot for a gourmet meal. What it is great for, and why I'm giving it four stars, is because of the beautiful view over the pier.  It has some awesome seating on the rail, right outside.
