I suggest going there early in the morning, maybe even for sunrise, and getting a coffee. I also grabbed a bagel, toasted with cream cheese. It felt like a Bagel experience you would have at Starbucks or coffee bean. 

Stop in for the coffee and the views!

Absolutely my favorite spot for breakfast in Santa Barbara! Casual outdoor dining area on Stearns wharf with absolutely gorgeous view of the ocean and the hills of Santa Barbara. Francisco, Blanca and the rest of the staff are always friendly and offer excellent service. They serve a range of espresso drinks, and a nice breakfast (and lunch) menu. My personal favorite is the huevos rancheros.  A great place to eat and appreciate the beauty of Santa Barbara.

response: Char West, located at 221 Stearns Wharf in Santa Barbara, California, is a diverse dining establishment offering a range of food options including fish and chips, seafood, and American traditional cuisine. The restaurant is open from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on weekdays and extends its hours to 9:00 PM on weekends, providing ample opportunity for visitors to enjoy their meals. Customers can reserve tables in advance, and the restaurant features outdoor seating with a picturesque view of the pier and ocean. Although it offers takeout services and validated parking, it does not provide Wi-Fi or valet services. The establishment's ambiance is described as casual and slightly touristy, with mixed reviews regarding the quality of its food. One customer found the fish and chips to be of poor quality, tasting muddy, while another praised the coffee and view. Another review highly commended Char West for its breakfast menu and attentive staff. Overall, the restaurant maintains a moderate rating of 3.0 stars based on customer feedback.

review_info.review_text: Need some real California Mexican food? This is the spot. Everything is incredible. My mouth waters thinking of the carnitas.
What a great local restaurant.  We always get good service and good food!   I have to say this is surprisingly clean food, free of extra salt and fat which I've often experience at other Taquerias.
My personal favorite breakfast burrito option in Santa Barbara. Amazing ingredients, tortilla and salsa options. Highly recommend!

response: El Zarape, a local Mexican restaurant located at 1435 San Andres St in Santa Barbara, CA, has earned a reputation for its authentic California Mexican cuisine, as highlighted by its perfect five-star reviews. The restaurant is known for its diverse menu, with standout dishes like the carnitas and a highly recommended breakfast burrito. Customers appreciate the quality and freshness of the ingredients, noting that the food is clean and free of excessive salt and fat, which is a refreshing change from many other taquerias. While there is no outdoor seating or Wi-Fi, the restaurant offers takeout services and is suitable for group dining. El Zarape operates from 6:30 AM to 9:00 PM daily, with street parking available. The casual and inviting ambience makes it a welcoming spot for both locals and visitors, consistently receiving high praise for its service and food quality.

source_info.name: Uniboil
source_info.categories: Food, Bubble Tea, Chinese, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Hot Pot

review_info.review_text:
I ate here three times already.

Parking is easy; there are plenty of spaces. They have both indoor and outdoor dining. The restaurant is connected to Phresh Tea (located on the right), and both use the same kitchen, so you can order Boba or anything on Phresh Tea menu while dining at Uniboil. 

Uniboil are known for their hotpots. They also have other dishes on the menu if you're not into that. The prices are reasonable, and the hotpot portion is huge; you could probably share it with another person if you aren't too hungry. 

I really enjoyed the Beef Thai Tom Yum Hotpot. I've also had the Korean Army Stew the first time my family and I went, and it was good; I do prefer the Thai one better though. I've tried the sizzling beef dish (forgot what is called), popcorn chicken, and beef noodle soup. Sizzling beef and popcorn chicken were fantastic. I didn't like the beef noodle soup. The broth tasted fine, but the meats were terrible. I didn't have any meats in my bowl actually; it was like just fatty parts. 

Customer service has been inconsistent; sometimes they're slow, and other times they're quick. Staffs are friendly though. They checked up on us all the time.

Their boba drink is surprisedly good, I have a high standard for boba, their boba is definitely above average. Try their kumquat drink, or milk drink with less sweet ( it could be really sweet ). As for their food, I ordered a noodle soup for my son, the soup is good but not the round noodle they use. Order their drink if you visit.

Felt weird vibes here. Was confused that it was also attached to the tea place next door and all the workers were more situated there. Thus it was a while and took effort to get a table at the restaurant side. Even tho there was only one other party there... 

We came for the beef noodle soup and coffee. The soup Is the first picture on Yelp and looked delicious. But upon ordering the waitress said they didn't have it. They had run out. Plus they didn't have coffee either. At the end we decided not to stay

response: Uniboil, located at 5599 Hollister Ave, Unit C in Goleta, CA, is a vibrant restaurant specializing in Asian fusion cuisine, including Chinese, Bubble Tea, and Hot Pot. The restaurant operates daily from 11:30 AM to 8:30 PM, with ample parking available in the lot. Uniboil offers both indoor and outdoor seating, providing a trendy yet casual dining experience. Customers can enjoy a variety of dishes, with hot pot being a standout feature. A popular dish is the Beef Thai Tom Yum Hotpot, although other options like the Korean Army Stew and sizzling beef are also highly recommended. The restaurant is known for its generous portion sizes and reasonable prices. Reviews indicate that while the service can sometimes be inconsistent, the staff remains friendly and attentive. One customer noted the exceptional quality of the boba drinks, particularly the kumquat flavor and milk drinks with reduced sweetness. However, there have been instances where menu items, such as the beef noodle soup and coffee, were unavailable, leading to mixed reviews. Uniboil caters to groups and offers takeout services, making it a versatile dining option in the area.

review_info.review_text: Nice change of pace for a quick bite to eat. Tri-tip and Reuben Piadinas were tasty and reasonably priced.

When you're sitting in the salon getting your hair done a couple of doors down, its lunch time, and you want a yummy  wrap that encompasses all of the ingredients of a reuben sandwich, you come to Montecito Deli and order the Reuben Piadina! The warm piadini fits perfectly into your hand. Once you bite into it, you get all the layers of the reuben sandwich bursting into your mouth! The pastrami perfectly seasoned,  the sauerkraut with just the right amount of sour and tart, and the pickle, tomatoes, and thousand island dressing. And we can't forget that yummy Swiss cheese that's perfectly melted.
Jeff (the owner) and his guys are the best...food is great too We work right next door and are lucky to have them as neighbors!

response: Montecito Deli & Catering, located at 1150 Coast Village Rd in Santa Barbara, CA, is a local favorite deli and restaurant known for its quick, tasty meals. The establishment offers a limited weekday menu from 7:30 AM to 2:00 PM and is noted for its casual, no-frills ambiance. Customers appreciate the option for outdoor seating and the ability to take their food to go. The deli is particularly celebrated for its unique Reuben Piadina, which combines the classic flavors of a Reuben sandwich into a warm, hand-held wrap, earning rave reviews for its perfectly seasoned pastrami, tangy sauerkraut, and gooey Swiss cheese. The owner, Jeff, is highly regarded for his friendly service, contributing to a loyal customer base, including those who work nearby. With a rating of 4.5 stars based on numerous positive reviews, Montecito Deli & Catering stands out for its convenient location, quality food, and welcoming atmosphere.

review_info.review_text: Always loved coming here.Anna new everyone by name. Service is now horribly slow. Staff is not friendly as a matter of fact they are sullen and rude
Great place. I highly recommend, not just as a breakfast place but they also make amazing birthday cakes with any design you like.
Rude. Would not allow us to place order because I took my mask off at the table to eat. Wife was ordering and we decided to leave.

response:
Reynaldo's Bakery is a local eatery located at 895 Linden Ave in Carpinteria, CA. It is known for its offerings in Mexican cuisine and baked goods. The bakery operates daily from 5:30 AM, closing at 7:00 PM on Sundays and 6:00 PM on Saturdays. The business offers street and lot parking, and while it does not provide outdoor seating or reservations, it supports takeout orders. Customers can expect a casual dining environment with no available WiFi.

Customer reviews highlight both positive and negative aspects of the experience. One customer praised the bakery for its exceptional birthday cakes and recommended it as a great place for breakfast. However, other reviews have criticized the slow service and unfriendly staff, with one customer even leaving due to perceived rudeness over mask policies. Despite these issues, Reynaldo's Bakery maintains a high rating of 4.5 stars.

review_info.review_text: Hands down my favorite coffee joint in IV. Their beans and teas are great, and they have a pretty good selection of bagels, pastries, and other treats that round it off as a really nice place to start your day. The staff is generally friendly, especially the guy who runs the place. Possibly the best part of Java Jones is that their large drinks come with four shots of espresso, which is spectacular for any caffeine junkie. Their prices are reasonable, and although they're renovating the inside now, it sounds like the place is gonna be nice and clean once they're all finished up. Java Jones is highly recommended by this yelper.
On a warm day there is nothing more satisfying than an Iced Coffee from Java Jones.  Super refreshing and a great uber low calorie (I like mine black) pick-me-up.

I've been here a few times and the service has been pretty good. The drinks themselves are so-so and the music is ok for the most part. I like this place way more then starbucks but for the best coffee place in IV that has got to be Caje! This place does not compare to Caje.

So if you feel like changing it up and not going to starbucks and for some crazy reason you don't want to try Caje then I'd recommend this place.

response:
Java Jones, located at 6560 Pardall Rd, Ste C in Goleta, California, is a versatile eatery and coffee shop known for its wide-ranging menu of coffee and food options. The restaurant operates daily from 7:00 AM to 12:00 AM, offering customers a consistent schedule for their visits. It provides an outdoor seating area and free WiFi, making it a convenient spot for both casual meet-ups and work sessions.

Customer reviews highlight the establishment’s strengths, particularly its coffee and tea selections, which are praised for their quality and variety. Many patrons appreciate the generous espresso shots in larger drink sizes, catering well to coffee enthusiasts. The shop also offers a range of bagels and pastries, enhancing its appeal as a morning destination. While one customer mentions ongoing renovations, another notes that the ambiance and cleanliness are expected to improve post-renovation. The staff is generally described as friendly, contributing positively to the overall experience. Despite one customer's preference for a competitor, Java Jones receives high marks for its affordability and refreshing beverage options, especially the iced coffee.

source_info.name: El Sitio
source_info.categories: Ethnic Food, Restaurants, Mexican, Specialty Food, Imported Food, Food

review_info.review_text: Can't go wrong here. Sounds boring but I actually think the chicken quesadilla with onion is pretty standout. The chicken is super peppery - would also recommend just chicken and onion tacos. Burritos are always a big hit too.
This used to be one of our favorite little take-out places pre-COVID. It's just gone downhill on food plus higher prices.  Gave it a few tries to be fair but not going back.

If you enjoy over paying for burritos and eating tastes tasteless starches..this will be your go to. I live around the corner as always try to give this family shop The benefit of the doubt. But the truth is this food fucking sucks. Sorry excuse for anyone trying to reach Mexican food and don't need their call themselves authentic. Horrible anyone who truly enjoys his spot a has never been south of the border and B must have the tongue amputated because I can't take the damn thing every time I've eaten here

response: El Sitio is an ethnic food establishment located at 138 S Salinas St in Santa Barbara, California. It offers a variety of Mexican and specialty foods, including imported options. The restaurant features outdoor seating and takeout services but does not provide reservations or garage parking. Customers can park on the street or in a lot nearby. Despite mixed reviews, El Sitio maintains a four-star rating based on customer feedback. One reviewer praises the restaurant for its standout chicken quesadilla with onion and peppery chicken, as well as its burritos. However, other customers have expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of food and pricing, noting a decline in the food's taste and an increase in prices since before the pandemic. These reviews suggest that while some patrons enjoy the establishment’s offerings, others find the experience disappointing.

review_info.review_text: Oh my goodness, the staff here is so nice and the food is ready so quickly! Options to sit inside or outside. I ordered the classic quesadilla and it comes with guac and sour cream! My friend got the combo burrito and soup. Such a great and convenient spot!

This spot is the worst Mexican food I have ever tasted. The food has no flavor what so ever and their meat is low quality and taste so bland. I will not come here again and would not recommend it to anyone

Delicious burritos! Fairly priced in contrast with other similar restaurants. People who work there are friendly and accommodating. I especially appreciate Juan who always prepares my Burrito in the way that I like it. He smiles when I arrive and remembers how I like my Chicken Burrito prepared!  He's the best burrito chef and a nice guy at that! Thank you Juan!

response:
La Salsa Fresh Mexican Grill is a popular Mexican restaurant located at 3987 State St, Ste D in Santa Barbara, California. The restaurant offers a variety of Mexican and Tex-Mex dishes, catering to those who prefer fast food options with a casual dining experience. It is open from 11:00 AM to 9:00 PM on weekdays and closes slightly earlier on Saturdays and Sundays. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating, and the restaurant provides takeout services, making it a convenient choice for those on the go.

The restaurant has received mixed reviews, with some praising the staff's friendliness and the quick service. A positive review highlighted the delicious burritos and the affordability of the menu, noting the personal touch provided by the staff, especially by Juan, who prepares custom orders. Another reviewer appreciated the option to sit both indoors and outdoors, and the availability of guacamole and sour cream with the classic quesadilla. However, another customer criticized the food quality, mentioning a lack of flavor and subpar meat quality. Despite this, the restaurant maintains a solid 4-star rating. La Salsa does not offer parking garage or street parking, but a parking lot is available.

source_info.name: Backyard Bowls
source_info.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Acai Bowls, Restaurants, Food

review_info.review_text: Delicious acai bowls! We loved it.

Solid bowls, always happy with the healthy breakfast bowl options. At this point it seems they are the only place in the neighborhood that sell non-greasy breakfast meals.
The bowls can be a bit pricey and they're service can be a little faster.
My favorite bowls ever. So many different options. Slightly pricey but super filling.

response: Backyard Bowls, located at 5668 Calle Real in Goleta, California, is a local eatery known for serving a variety of breakfast and brunch options, including acai bowls and smoothies. The restaurant is open daily from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM and offers outdoor seating as well as takeout services. Customers appreciate the casual ambiance and the wide array of healthy breakfast bowl options available. The establishment is praised for its delicious acai bowls and healthy meal choices, which are noted as somewhat pricey but highly satisfying. Customers also mention the restaurant's parking lot and the fact that it is the only place in the area offering non-greasy breakfast meals. Despite some suggestions for faster service, the overall customer satisfaction is evident, as reflected by the high rating of 4.5 stars.

source_info.name: Angry Wings
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Specialty Food, Burgers, Food, Chicken Wings, Sandwiches, Food Delivery Services

review_info.review_text: Great wings in IV! I used to come here all the time with my cousin. I'm not sure if the place is still open, but if it is, be sure to check it out. You can't graduate without trying Angry Wings. If you're vegan, they have vegan wings!

The patio is awesome here, IF you can find a spot. Their beer prices seem higher compared to other places nearby. The wings are pretty good. I would give this place another star, but they were CLOSED all summer! WTF!

Food is excellent. Customer service is very good. Not much to complain about. 
However, they straight up told me that they did not have any nutrition information. I was slightly bothered by that, and I am also pretty sure it is required by law..... But still amazing wings!!

response:
Angry Wings, located at 6530 Pardall Rd in Isla Vista, CA, is a popular restaurant known for its specialty food, particularly chicken wings and burgers. Operating from 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily, the establishment offers a variety of food options including sandwiches and vegan wing alternatives. Customers can enjoy outdoor seating in a casual ambiance, and the restaurant provides free WiFi and takeout services. Parking is available on-site, and the venue is well-suited for group gatherings.

Reviews indicate a mix of positive and constructive feedback. One reviewer highly praises the wings, recommending them as a must-try for Isla Vista graduates, while another appreciates the patio but criticizes the summer closure and higher beer prices. A third review commends the food quality and customer service, albeit with a concern over the lack of nutritional information provided. Overall, Angry Wings maintains a 3.5-star rating, reflecting a generally satisfactory experience with room for improvement in certain areas.

source_info.name: Pastavino
source_info.address: Camino Real Marketplace, 6920 Market Pl Dr

review_info.review_text: I took my family here after reading some of the reviews from my fellow yelpers but we were unimpressed. We ordered garlic bread, a focaccia urger, kids mac and cheese, and spaghetti with meatballs. The garlic bread was okay but didn't really taste like garlic. The mac and cheese was gritty and extremely hot when they served it (which I would prefer to cold but my 3 year old wasn't too happy about having to wait to eat it). We can usually tell if we are going to like an italian restaurant based on their red sauce and I would have to say it was just okay. The focaccia burger was also just okay. I don't think we'll try it again.

It's amazing this restaurant is still open.  They have a really good beet salad, but the restaurant is almost always empty.  They recently took down an overhead portion above the bar and it's really lightened the place up.  I like the booths which give you the ability to have a private conversation and they're comfortable.  The bread is okay.  They often have coupons in the paper for buy one, get one free and that's what makes it worth coming back for (and I really like the beet salad).

I love this restaurant! From beginning to end we had an excellent experience.  Casey our waiter was attentive and friendly.  We had italian sodas and we were so happy to get a huge carafe of refills, then we had delicious garlic bread and salad.  The portions are big and we shared a salad and it was plenty for two.  We had the ahi and it was tasy, followed by the penne pasta which we also shared and they kindly split our entrees into two plates for us.  The finale was the s'mores dessert which is fun and delicious.  We were visiting from out of town or I would frequent this restaurant.  Casey made us want for nothing and I so appreciate good service AND good food, that makes for a great dining experience!

response:
Pastavino is an Italian restaurant located at Camino Real Marketplace, 6920 Market Pl Dr, Goleta, CA, offering a diverse menu that includes pizza and other Italian dishes. The restaurant is open from 11:30 AM to 9:00 PM daily and provides free WiFi, outdoor seating, and the option for takeout orders. Customers can make reservations and find parking in the lot nearby.

Reviews indicate a mixed experience among diners. One family found the garlic bread and mac and cheese underwhelming and not up to their standards, leading them to conclude that they would not return. Another visitor appreciated the beet salad and the restaurant's ambiance, particularly the booths and lighting, but noted that the establishment is often empty, suggesting that promotional deals like buy-one-get-one-free coupons are a significant draw. In contrast, a reviewer had an excellent experience, praising the attentive service, flavorful dishes, and generous portions. The restaurant maintains a moderate rating of 3.0 stars based on these varied customer experiences.

source_info.name: 1114 Sports Bar & Games
source_info.categories: Beer Bar, Sports Bars, Pubs, Bars, Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Gastropubs, Nightlife, Tapas Bars

review_info.review_text: My buddies and I come here all the time for food and drinks whilst watching the football. Sadly they've recently increased their prices exponentially (salmon dish increased more than $10!). We like the spot but the prices are getting out of control.

Sadly didn't eat here. Apparently they were having issues with their reservation system so they weren't sure where to seat us. Initially the hostess told us she could sit us up stairs but we'd have to order at the bar. Then she switched things up and sat us at a long table but it was super crowded so we tried upstairs. We quickly abandoned that as it didn't seem like it would be enjoyable. We decided to leave. As we were leaving the other person waiting on a table because of a messed up reservation was sitting at a table downstairs. Not really sure why we weren't offered that table or the other empty one we saw. It was a playoff game day so I understand that they were busy but I got the impression they were a complete mess not ready to handle that many people. My wife did say the food looked good. Maybe we'll try again next time where in SB.

For being a sports bar, this place gets 5 stars for location, classiness, affordability, and excellent service. You can really sense that they work as a team here; the host, server, and busboy were all gracious and attentive. The food was surprisingly affordable and tasty. I was expecting greasy bar food, but they also have salads, brussel sprouts and an affordable salmon dish. Two appetizers, a sparkling rose, chicken Cesar salad and an entire salmon meal ended up being around $80+tip. 

I loved the gas fireplace on each outdoor table that pumped out heat, and I loved the sound of the water overlooking the turtle pond. I felt so happy resting and dining here, it is a quiet and quaint spot off State Street.

response: 1114 Sports Bar & Games is a diverse entertainment venue located at 1114 State St in Santa Barbara, California, offering a blend of dining, sports viewing, and gaming experiences. It is categorized under several types of establishments including Beer Bars, Sports Bars, Pubs, Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Gastropubs, Tapas Bars, and Nightlife venues. The bar is known for its free WiFi, outdoor seating, and validated parking garage. Regular customers enjoy watching football while enjoying food and drinks, although recent price hikes have been noted, particularly for the salmon dish which saw a significant increase. Customer service and the ambiance have received mixed reviews, with some praising the attentive staff and upscale, classy atmosphere, while others have faced issues with the reservation system and seating management during busy periods. Despite these challenges, the bar remains a popular spot for groups, offering a unique blend of casual and trendy dining options.

review_info.review_text: Flashback!  My old happy hour spot. Great outdoor patio. Glad I got one last visit in. They are closed now and new restaurant is on the way.
food was good, maybe a little over priced, but what they lacked in quality they made up for in customer service.

I seriously thought I was on candid camera or something.  I came in for a late lunch one day and everything I got here was absolutely wretched...even their drinks!

Its such a shame because they have a great location and a nice outdoor patio...how do they stay in business??

I must say this place also gets an award: the absolute worst calamari I've ever sampled in my life (and that's saying something).

response:
State & A Bar and Grill, located at 1201 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, was a notable establishment known for its bar and grill offerings, as well as its contributions to the local nightlife scene. The restaurant served a variety of food options, including barbeque, and was accessible through street parking. Outdoor seating was a highlight, with patrons praising the pleasant atmosphere and spacious patio. The business allowed for takeout orders and was generally considered good for group outings.

Customer reviews, however, were mixed. A few customers appreciated the customer service and outdoor dining experience, although some found the food to be overpriced and of poor quality. One particularly negative review described the calamari as the worst ever tasted, and expressed disbelief at the restaurant’s continued operation despite its shortcomings. Overall, the business had a modest rating of 3.0 stars, reflecting a blend of positive and negative customer experiences. As of the last review, the establishment had closed, with plans for a new restaurant to occupy the same location.

review_info.review_text: I love ceviche, have sampled it many places in Santa Barbara but none as fresh and inventive as the choices at Challwa. I came to know this pop up after trying the equally delicious empanadas at Buena Onda (at the same location during the week). The Ahi ceviche and the mixed ceviche with shrimp, fish, octopus was delicious. I can see me coming back weekly!
Ceviche Nikkei is absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend this considering the quality of ceviche at most places in Santa Barbara.

I'm Peruvian and 100% approved this restaurant.
The leche de tigre and ceviches are amazing

response: Challwa is a highly-rated Peruvian restaurant and pop-up establishment located at 724 E Haley St in Santa Barbara, California. Known for its fresh and inventive ceviche, Challwa has garnered a 4.5-star rating from customers. The restaurant operates on Sundays from 11:30 AM to 4:00 PM, offering a unique dining experience that stands out in the local culinary scene. Reviews highlight the exceptional quality of its ceviche, with patrons praising the freshness and creativity of dishes such as the Ahi ceviche and a mixed ceviche featuring shrimp, fish, and octopus. A Peruvian reviewer particularly commends the leche de tigre and the overall authenticity of the offerings. Challwa's success is further underscored by its association with Buena Onda, another popular spot in the same location during the week.

source_info.categories: American (New), Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Food Delivery Services, Food, Personal Chefs, Shopping, Cafes, Event Planning & Services, American (Traditional), Burgers, Seafood, Professional Services, Personal Assistants

review_info.review_text: RIP Restaurant Open. I really liked their breakfast options and had a great review ...when it was "open" but was sad to find out from the owner (who still answered when I called) that they are no longer open for business. They do still cater but I think that is under another business name.
Restaurant OPEN. No longer open. Just open for catering. To bad because the food was good.

Have been to the restaurant 3 times to redeem my groupon and all 3 times the restaurant has been closed with a sign on the door that says "closed for off site work" I understood the 1st time, but when we return 2 more times and still the same sign on the door and parchment paper covering the restaurant name and business hours is not acceptable. No one answered the phone when I called for an explanation either. My Groupon has now expired and I want my money back.

response: Restaurant OPEN, located at 4141 State St, Ste E1 in Santa Barbara, CA, was known for its diverse culinary offerings including American (New), Burgers, Seafood, and Breakfast & Brunch. The restaurant operated primarily on weekdays from 8:00 AM to 11:30 AM, though it was reported to be closed on Mondays. Customers praised the food quality and the diverse menu options. However, the business faced challenges with consistent availability, as noted by customers who encountered closures multiple times. Despite its high rating of 4.5 stars, several reviews reflected disappointment due to the restaurant's closure. As of recent reviews, it appears that while Restaurant OPEN is no longer open for dine-in services, it continues to offer catering under a different business name. The restaurant does not provide outdoor seating, reservations, or garage parking but offers free WiFi and takeout services. It is noted for its casual ambience and suitability for group dining.

source_info.name: Petros Restaurant
source_info.categories: Greek, Restaurants, Mediterranean, Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits, American (New)

review_info.review_text: We called the restaurant, and it went to a greeting, then checked the website, and made a reservation on OpenTable for 10 of us. Got to the restaurant and, surprise, surprise, it was closed!!!! If you are going to have a website, a phone greeting, or an OpenTable listing for your business, show the customers at least a little courtesy and put some sort of notice when you are not going to be open.

I was dying to go here (We'd been to the Petros in Solvang a while back and being an optimist, imagined it would be the same or better). On a recent visit to SB, we went in for dinner. First of all, the service was outstanding--warm and welcoming, eager and friendly, very caring and kind people, from the hostess to our server to the manager--everyone was so very sweet, it made up for our letdown with the food. To be fair, we live in the Bay Area with Kokkari in S.F. and Evvia in Palo Alto, and we'd had an unbelievable time at Petros Solvang--so we went in with expectations off the chart. Maybe this was the problem--it wasn't that their food was intrinsically bad; it was good. It just didn't sparkle, didn't blow our minds . . . the watermelon and feta salad was good, albeit not super alive with flavor. The grilled octopus was a good dose of protein, though with slightly muddled flavor (we were expecting it to be charred and tender), which is a tough call for octopus. While we were looking over the menu, we didn't see lamb listed, and were expressing disappointment to each other. Our server who had not yet come to our table, and was doing something else at the adjacent table, overheard us, and came over to reassure. He was just so sweet: going over not one or two, but three different lamb options. I mean, seriously, what kind of Greek restaurant doesn't have lamb, right? Petros had terrific lamb options: we had the lamb loin or was it the chops? They were good; again, not so memorable that I'd track down a postcard and write home about them. But they were good enough that we scarfed down everything :-) At some point during our dinner, someone spilled water everywhere near our table on the floor, and the manager was on top of it, asking someone to mop it up (before we tripped). We didn't stay for dessert, but I'd give anything to live near Petros, and I could go in for lunch anytime, we'd have a ball. Btw, the next day we were having dinner across the street at sunset, and Petros was the site for an outdoor wedding party/reception. We watched a gorgous and touching show--traffic stopped on the street while the bride and groom took photos, her white train trailing the street, veil blowing in the breeze . . . I damn near cried.
Awesome food and service! Just got back from Greece and this restaurant met our expectations of traditional Greek dishes.

response:
Petros Restaurant, located at 1316 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a Greek establishment that also offers Mediterranean, New American, and a variety of beverages including beer and wine. The restaurant is known for its free WiFi and outdoor seating, and it welcomes reservations for groups. Customers can park on the street nearby, and the restaurant is praised for its excellent service, particularly its welcoming and caring staff. However, one negative review highlighted an incident where the restaurant was unexpectedly closed despite having a website, phone greeting, and OpenTable listing, which caused significant inconvenience to the customers.

Reviews reflect a range of experiences, with one customer giving a 5-star review for the traditional Greek dishes that met their high expectations after a trip to Greece. Another review, while giving 4 stars, noted that while the food was good, it did not match the high standards set by other Greek restaurants they had visited. This reviewer was particularly impressed by the attentive and friendly service and the restaurant's efforts to accommodate special requests, such as offering several lamb dishes despite not initially listing them on the menu.

Overall, Petros Restaurant seems to excel in customer service but may not always meet expectations in terms of food quality or operational consistency.

review_info.review_text:
This restaurant focuses on small plates; burgers, sandwiches and all the fixings in small (and inexpensive) easy to sample or share plates. 

Cheese burger - perfectly hits the spot. What're can I say; I was craving a cheeseburger and this one delivered. 
Fries - thin and crisp, the way I like them. 
Tater tots - a bit under-seasoned but good. 
Chicken Pot pie - definitely a show stealer. Highly recommend eating with the fries; kind if like fries and gravy. 
Shrimp sandwich - so far the only low point. A single shrimp butterflied and served on a sandwich. Good, but nothing I couldn't do on a lazy afternoon at home. 
Turkey burger - heavy in the seasoning and quite tasty. 
Berry crisp - another show stealer. Not what I was expecting, and definitely was very happy to order it, and will again without hesitation. 
Dark chocolate frozen banana pieces - pretty much the same as I make at home on hot summer afternoons. Nothing to write home about.

Went here on a Friday night, only 3 tables had people and 2 people at the bar.  There was no one to seat us.  Finally the guy from the bar came to seat us.  They wanted to seat us next to the bathroom.  We asked to be seated elsewhere and they gave us another table in the empty restaurant.  We sat down, and waited and waited and waited.  We were never offered to order anything, so we got up and left.  We should've known the reason it was empty is the service is bad, maybe their food is good but I'll never know.

I am glad I'm finally getting around to this review. I went here in a pleasant October evening after a few drinks at OKR, craving some late night eats and pleasant company. While service at the bar was slow and relatively inattentive I was able to get my order in of an old fashioned, the wild boar slider, onion rings, and Mac and cheese. First, the bad. Never, ever, ever list a menu item as truffle (blank) if you are just going to use truffle oil. It tastes like stale olive oil and chemicals. Also, use some sharp cheese. The creaminess was on point, but the flavor of the cheese was overwhelmed by the pungent odder of the truffle oil. The next, the mediocre. The onion rings were more onion straws, but semantics and preference aside, not bad. They weren't greasy, and for $3.50 served up quite the plate. But the highlight of the meal (and the warrant for 5 stars) was the wild boar slider and the expertly crafted old fashioned. The slider was juice, porky, and a pleasant several bites that I couldn't imagine tasting better. The patty was juicy and sumptuous, leaving little more to be desired. No condiments needed. The old fashioned was strong and Smokey, perfect for a chilly night and paired with the boar perfectly. I will (and have) returned frequently for your small, yet satisfying, bites of perfection. Just hold the truffle oil next time.

response:
The Pan, located at 18 E Cota St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a restaurant specializing in tapas, small plates, and comfort food. It offers a unique dining experience with a variety of dishes that are easy to share or sample individually. The restaurant allows reservations and takeout orders, and it provides outdoor seating, making it a suitable choice for group outings. However, the parking options are limited, with no garage, street, validated, lot, or valet parking available.

Customer reviews highlight both the strengths and weaknesses of The Pan. One review praises the restaurant for its flavorful food, particularly the cheeseburger, tater tots, chicken pot pie, and berry crisp, which were highly recommended. Another review, however, criticizes the poor service, noting a lack of attentiveness and responsiveness from the staff, which led to a negative experience. A third review appreciates the quality of the wild boar slider and the old-fashioned cocktail, despite some reservations about the use of truffle oil. The Pan has received an average rating of 4 stars, reflecting a mix of positive and negative experiences reported by its patrons.

review_info.review_text:
Not thrilled with this restaurant. 

1. Hostess who seated us seemed irritated with us, and did not present herself well 
2. Waiter was OK, but not much warmth here either though
3. Jambalaya was good
4. Seafood Gumbo didn't do down well, but this was my first time having this dish, so maybe it was me...
5. Cornbread was OK
6. Andoullie Sausage on the side was good

I would not return to this location.

Hooray for beignets! We devoured our warm fried pillows of deliciousness under a blanket of powdered sugar and maple syrup. Traditional and sweet. Followed by delectable fluffy biscuits and gravy with eggs, some of the best gravy around, and that's coming from a gravy snob. Large portions, great prices, and service was friendly and fast. Brunch was a bona fide success! Other offerings include chilequiles and jambalaya.  You can't go wrong with Cajun Kitchen. Yum yum in the tum tum.
Great food, good service, fair ambiance. Love the tritip Benedict. Great food, good service, fair ambiance. Love the tritip Benedict.

response:
Cajun Kitchen Cafe, located at 6025 Calle Real in Goleta, CA, is a well-regarded establishment that serves Cajun and Creole cuisine, offering a variety of breakfast and brunch options. Customer reviews highlight both the strengths and areas for improvement at the cafe. One customer gave a mixed review, noting dissatisfaction with the hostess's attitude and the quality of the seafood gumbo, although they found the jambalaya and andouille sausage satisfactory. review_info.review_text: Of the 3 selections - all selections were picture perfect -  bowl of porridge was the best - hot and delicious with honey on top and bananas. Açaí bowl was good though a tad cold - Avocado on toast - spouts were slightly tasteless and toast cold - good atmosphere to this place - note - limited seating so get there early.

The flagship store!!! This should be a landmark in SANTA BARBARA, the place where backyard bowls started it's Açaí domination. Simply put, best in class. Delicious, nutritious, quality ingredients. GO there NOW, thank me later!
Had an açaí bowl and shared an avocado toast. The bowl was fine, have definitely had better. The toast was good but not amazing. For healthy food in the area, it's a great option.

response: Backyard Bowls, located at 331 Motor Way in Santa Barbara, California, is a versatile eatery offering a range of health-conscious food options, including coffee, tea, ice cream, smoothies, and a variety of breakfast dishes. Known for its diverse menu that caters to both health enthusiasts and casual diners, the restaurant operates daily from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Customers appreciate the establishment's outdoor seating and the option for takeout, though it lacks on-site parking and does not offer reservations. Reviews highlight the quality of its açai bowls and porridge, with one customer praising the porridge as "hot and delicious." Another review lauds the restaurant for its "best in class" açai offerings and nutritious ingredients. source_info.question: how to explain quartiles
source_info.passages:
passage 1:The first quartile is also known as 25th percentile, the second quartile as 50th percentile, and the third quartile as 75th percentile. The Interquartile range is from Q1 to Q3. It is the difference between lower quartile and upper quartile. First arrange the data in ascending order.

passage 2:In statistics, quartiles are three points that divide the data set into four equal groups. Each group represents the one-fourth of the data set. First quartile (Q 1), also known as lower quartile, splits the lower 25% of data. It is the middle value of lower half. Second quartile (Q 2) which is more commonly known as median splits the data in half (50%). Median divides the data into a lower half and an upper half. Third quartile (Q 3), also known as upper quartile, splits lowest 75% (or highest 25%) of data.

passage 3:The first quartile is also known as 25th percentile, the second quartile as 50th percentile, and the third quartile as 75th percentile. (A percentile is the value of a variable below which a certain percent of observations fall) The Interquartile range is from Q1 to Q3.

response:
Quartiles are statistical measures that divide a dataset into four equal parts. Each quartile represents a quarter of the dataset. Specifically:

- The first quartile (Q1), also known as the lower quartile, marks the 25th percentile. This means that 25% of the data points fall below this value.
- The second quartile (Q2) is the median, or the 50th percentile. It signifies that 50% of the data points are below this value and it splits the data into two equal halves.
- The third quartile (Q3), also known as the upper quartile, marks the 75th percentile. This means 75% of the data points fall below this value.

To find quartiles, first arrange the data in ascending order. The quartiles then are the values that divide this ordered list into four equal parts.

source_info.question: what is the difference in AF-C and AF-A

passage 1:AF-S is AF 'single'- your camera will focus on a fixed object when you press the AF button and will remain focused on that point for as long as you hold the button down.This is best for static subjects.AF-C is AF 'continuous' - the camera will focus on whatever is in the relevant AF points (depending on how you have your AF coverage set up) and will attempt to keep the subject in focus wherever it moves, whether that's towards/away from the camera or laterally.F-A is AF 'auto' and automatically switches between the two AF modes depending on what the subject is doing. This requires less effort on the part of the photographer, but you are relying on the camera guessing correctly what you are focussing on, and may result in unexpected focus.

passage 2:up vote 16 down vote accepted. AF-C (AF-continuous or servo mode) is used for photographing moving subjects. AF-S means single shot and is used for subject that is stationary. AF-A is where the camera decides whether the subject is moving or not and tries to alternate between the servo and single shot mode accordingly.dd a comment |. up vote 5 down vote. There is another important difference between AF-S and AF-C. With AF-S, you cannot take a shot without focus being locked (green light being on). With AF-C you will take a shot anytime the shutter release is pressed.

passage 3:AF-C is continuous, when you focus on an object, holding it (half-)pressed, it will continue to try to keep whatever is in the focus areas in focus, whether you move or the subject moves, or you move the focus area to another subject.F-S is single, when you focus on one object and hold it (half-)pressed, it will keep the focus where it locked. This includes any movement of you/camera, and the movement of the subject. This is used for recomposing (once you lock focus, you can rotate the camera and the object will stay in focus).

response: AF-C (AF-Continuous) is designed for moving subjects, where the camera continuously adjusts focus as the subject moves. AF-A (AF-Auto) automatically switches between AF-S and AF-C modes based on whether the camera detects the subject as moving or stationary, aiming to reduce the need for manual mode switching by the photographer.

response:

1. Purpose: Accounts receivable are the amounts owed to a company by its customers, whereas accounts payable are the amounts that a company owes to its suppliers.
2. Classification: Receivables are classified as a current asset, while payables are classified as a current liability.
3. Accounting Impact: Accounts Payable is recorded as a liability and decreases the company’s cash, whereas Accounts Receivable is considered an asset and will increase the company’s cash.

source_info.question: how to prepare blood slide
source_info.passages:
passage 1:If you'd like to see red blood cells, you'll need to learn how to do a Blood Smear. Everything is simple except pricking your finger! Level: Adult supervision (Perhaps for a blood donation too, unless someone has a boo-boo!). Materials: Slide, cover slip, needle, matches or lighter. First sterilize the needle with a flame.

passage 2:Blood can carry diseases that can be transferred from person to person. One should always avoid coming into contact with another person's blood. If it is unavoidable, one should wear rubber gloves. Put a drop of blood toward one end of a slide.

passage 3:How to Make a Blood Smear STEP ONE: Place clean glass slide on a flat surface. Add one small drop of blood to one end. STEP TWO: Take another clean slide, and holding at an angle of about 45 deg, touch the blood with one end of the slide so the blood runs along the edge of the slide by capillary action. Push carefully along the length of the first slide to produce a thin smear of blood. STEP THREE: Make 2 smears, allow to air dry, and label clearly. Once dried place in the provided slide transport containers.

response:
To prepare a blood slide, follow these steps based on the given passages:

1. Sterilize a needle with a flame.
2. Place a clean glass slide on a flat surface.
3. Prick your finger with the sterilized needle and add a small drop of blood to one end of the slide.
4. Take another clean slide and hold it at about a 45-degree angle.
5. Touch the blood drop with the edge of the second slide to allow the blood to spread by capillary action along the edge.
6. Gently push the second slide along the length of the first slide to make a thin smear of blood.
7. Repeat the process to make another smear for comparison.
8. Allow the smears to air dry.
9. Clearly label the slide.
10. Once dried, place the slide in a slide transport container for safekeeping or examination.
